title: Civil Engineer
description:
**About us**

Sumer Innovations is a building design startup that operates on its own online business platform and utilizes the latest advancements in building design technologies to provide superior services to its clients. Sumer Innovations' ultimate purpose is to create a sustainable construction industry through the collaboration of building design professionals and technological advancement.

We are connecting engineers, architects, and scientists, to provide efficient building design services, and we are looking for civil engineers to join our network and assist our clients locally and remotely throughout the USA.

***Before spending time reading job details and requirements, we want to emphasize that this is not a full-time or***\\_ **regular salaried position, and you will not be an employee of Sumer Innovations. You will be a consultant providing services for Sumer Innovations and its clients. This is a perfect opportunity for entrepreneurs, small business owners, self-emplyed professionals and independent contractors.**\\_

**Job description:**

You will be connected with Sumer Innovations' clients and prospects locally and remotely on the online platform to discuss the project scope and provide a quote. You will also be connected with our global network of experts with whom you will collaborate on projects. We have technical experts who can check your work and provide advice. We have drafters, junior and senior architects, and engineers who can do all the work within time and budget. You will decide whether to use other freelancers and how much to pay them to do the work. You will not be burned out or working by yourself, and you will have the opportunity to grow your income.

**Responsibilities:**

- Provide civil engineering services for residential and commercial projects.

- Prepare site plans, grading plans, utility plans, erosion and sediment control plan, drainage reports, Septic design, reports, site investigation, Landscape and irrigation plan, etc.  
- Conduct technical analysis and calculations to ensure the feasibility and efficiency of engineering designs.  
- Prepare engineering drawings, plans, and specifications using computer-aided design (CAD) software.  
- Collaborate with project teams to develop project scopes, budgets, and schedules.  
- Perform site visits and inspections to monitor construction progress and ensure compliance with design specifications.  
- Prepare technical reports, proposals, and presentations for clients and stakeholders.  
- Stay updated on industry trends, regulations, and advancements in civil engineering.

Requirements:

- Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering or a related field.

- Minimum 4 years of experience.  
- Professional Engineer (PE) license preferred.  
- Strong knowledge of civil engineering principles.  
- Proficiency in using computer-aided design (CAD) software for drafting and design purposes.  
- Experience with project engineering and management, including budgeting and scheduling.  
- Excellent technical writing skills for preparing reports, proposals, and presentations.  
- Strong problem-solving abilities with a focus on finding innovative solutions.  
- Ability to work effectively in a team environment and collaborate with cross-functional teams.

Note: This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. The employee may perform other related duties as negotiated to meet the ongoing needs of the organization.

Job Type: Contract

Pay: From $60.00 per hour

Expected hours: 10 – 40 per week

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule

Schedule:

* Choose your own hours
* On call

Location:

* Los Angeles, CA (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Facility Engineer
description:
**Facility Engineer**
At Salas O’Brien we tell our clients that we’re engineered for impact. This passion for making a difference applies just as much to our team as it does to our projects. That’s why we’re committed to living our values every day: inspiring, achieving, and connecting as shared owners of our success with a focus on a sustainable future.
Building for the long-term means that all of our team members can expect to work on amazing projects with a people-first approach to problem solving. It also means that each member of our team has truly limitless potential to build a unique, meaningful, and high-impact career—and they’ll receive great total rewards along the way.
**About Us:**
Founded in 1975, Salas O’Brien is an employee-owned engineering and professional services firm focused on achieving impact for our clients, our team, and the world. We know that tomorrow’s requirements are today’s opportunities, and we are here to design lasting solutions for pressing challenges.
We work across a variety of industries providing integrated engineering and consulting services. Our specialized experience includes design for data centers, healthcare, science and technology, high-rise buildings, clean energy, education, and other building types as well as structural and building sciences, infrastructure asset management, advanced robotics, and more.
Our technical expertise is paired with an exceptional team of business development, human resources, finance and accounting, information technology, and marketing professionals, all of whom play a key role in bringing our commitments to life every day.
**Job Summary:**
Salas O’Brien is seeking a Facility Engineer to join our onsite facility system and asset verification and documentation efforts of industrial buildings on government installations.
**In this role, you will:**
* Participate in the quality assurance aspects of facility asset verification, tagging, and documentation using client server and web-based technologies
* Apply verification methodology, knowledge, skills, tools, and techniques to project activities to meet project requirements
* Perform quality assurance efforts to support development projects and enhancements to production database systems
* Provide onsite verification support including creation, execution, and installation of asset identification
* Communicate results of quality analysis to project lead
* Quality representation in baseline project management activities
* Report project status Quality Metrics
* Identify and document mistakes and update production data in database based on field observations
* Support continuous improvement of project(s) to improve quality, efficiency, customer satisfaction, and program profitability
* Enrich asset and space data by applying applicable risk flag assignment as asset and space data changes


**Qualifications:**
* 2-4 years of engineering experience; facility systems experience preferred
* Bachelor's degree from accredited college in related discipline such as Mechanical, Electrical, or Civil Engineering, or equivalent experience/combined education
* Knowledge of the project development life cycle
* Proficient with the Microsoft Office suite of applications (e.g., Outlook, Word, Excel, etc.)
* Demonstrated experience and proficiency with database management
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills; ability to communicate at multiple levels, including: engineers, project managers, business analysts, and customers
* Strong problem solving and analytical skills
* Effective organizational skills, demonstrated by ability to set priorities, coordinate multiple projects simultaneously, and be attentive to detail
* Self-starter, work well within a team environment with minimal direction
* Excellent knowledge of health and safety standards
* Strong communication and organizational skills
* Good team player and leadership skills, focused and motivated, problem-solver
* Ability to work remote with some travel as needed to office in Bethesda, MD.


  

**Preferred Skills:**
* Background in facility engineering or installation of large-scale mechanical/electrical systems
* Inventory tracking and database quality assurance experience
* Experienced at reading drawings/schematics
* Familiarity with formatting and handling of documentation is desired
* Familiarity with engineering drawings and documentation is desired
* Previous experience with NUVOLO IWMS Software would be a plus
* Construction experience is a plus
* Detailed oriented


**Work Authorization Requirements:**
* Must be a US Citizen for Security Clearance requirements
* Ability to pass government background checks
* Ability to obtain government campus credentials


**Physical Demands:**
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
* Regularly spend long hours standing and using tablets/computers.
* Regularly perform site visits which will require climbing stairs and accessing spaces such as roofs, basements, and/or utility tunnels.
* Industrial site investigations may require extensive walking.

title: Civil/Structural Substation Engineer
description:
**b19 Consulting is working with an established Power Delivery Consultancy to find a Civil/Structural Substation Engineer that comes from an electric utility background.**

**Basic Qualifications:**

* 4+ years utility substation design experience
* Bachelor of Science in Civil Engineering

* Strong communication skills to coordinate with project engineers, designers and client representatives.
* Proficiency with Microsoft Office suite, particularly Excel & Word.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* 5-10 years of substation engineering experience
* PE License or working towards
* Expertise with structural analysis and design of steel & concrete substation structures
* Expertise with LPILE, STAAD, RISA software

* Rigid bus design and calculations

If interested and qualified, please apply with an updated resume.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $100,000.00 - $160,000.00 per year

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Remote

title: Civil/Structural Engineer
description:
Join Rimkus and unlock your potential with endless opportunities for growth, learning, and making a difference!



Rimkus (www.rimkus.com) is a worldwide leader in Engineering and Technical Consulting. Rimkus experts specialize in building envelope, engineering, forensic consulting, dispute resolution, construction management services, and solutions built for the environment.



NOW IS THE TIME to join this growing and stable company! We offer our full-time employees a competitive salary, bonus opportunities and a full benefits package that includes medical, dental, vision, life, disability, employer-matching 401(k), and opportunities for advancement!


**Overview of the job:**



Provides forensic consulting services requiring Civil Engineering expertise for insurance, legal, industrial, and other clients. Assesses and determines the cause and origin of structural failures and/or damage, building envelope failures and/or damage, and construction defects, as well as determine the extent and repairability of such failures and/or damage. Provides oral and written reports of findings and, when needed, expert testimony. Manages multiple projects.


**Essential Job Functions:**


* Performs the investigation and analysis of residential, commercial, and industrial properties to resolve claims and legal matters.
* Performs forensic assignments within the field of civil engineering expertise based upon a scope of work and budget prepared by the consultant and agreed upon by the Client in advance of performing the work.
* Field Investigations: Study and determine the cause and origin of construction defects or structural failures and/or damage, building envelope failures and/or damage, as well as determine the extent and repairability of such failures and/or damage. This includes gathering photographic evidence, conducting investigations to document on-site conditions, in-person and/or telephone interviews, overseeing field testing, reviewing construction and/or design drawings, contracts, or specifications, and/or reviewing historical documentation.
* Preparation of oral and written reports to document the causes of failure and/or damage, extent of loss, associated repair scope, and recommended remediation are essential, as is providing opinions and expert testimony in litigation matters.
* Manages multiple projects, coordinating with other experts and support as needed to produce client reports in a timely manner.
* Ensures that procedure is followed and performs safety and due-diligence of the project when it is being completed.
* Ability to initiate, develop, and maintain mutually beneficial client relationships.


**Required Experience, Education and Certifications:**


* B.S. Civil Engineering degree or higher.
* P.E. required in the state of employment or the ability to obtain it quickly.
* 2-10+ years of experience.
* Project Management and/or Field Investigation preferred.
* Depending on location, other licenses or certifications may be required.


**Required Skills and Abilities**


* Must have strong verbal and written communication skills.
* Must have strong organizational and time management skills.
* Must have high level of analytical skills. Work requires continual attention to detail with the ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions.
* Must be able to interact and communicate with clients at all levels (e.g. internal and external).
* Must have knowledge of a variety of computer software applications including but not limited to, Microsoft Office Applications and computer-assisted engineering and design software.
* Ability to read, analyze and interpret common scientific and technical reports or journals, financial reports and legal documents.
* Ability to write scopes-of-work, budget estimates, schedules, reports of findings, proposals, general correspondence, and other technical documents.
* Ability to respond to inquiries from internal and external clients. Capable of effectively presenting information to top management, clients, public groups and/or boards of directors.


**Physical Demands, Overtime, and Travel Requirements**


**Physical Demands** - Work is performed both in an office setting and at outside locations (i.e. Client’s office, industrial, construction, and/or residential sites). Employee is frequently required to stand, walk on slope roofs, sit, climb ladders, bend, climb inside attics and crawl under homes and tunnels, balance, stoop, kneel, crouch, talk, hear, use handheld equipment and/or tools, and drive a motor vehicle to job sites. Employee may lift and/or move up to 50 pounds. Employee must be sharp, focused, and alert when conducting site inspections, speaking and interacting with clients, preparing written reports of findings, and testifying in deposition or trial. Clear vision and depth perception are also necessary.


**Overtime** - This position is classified as salaried with an exempt FLSA status. Regular working hours are 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m., Monday through Friday, with one hour for lunch. There will be periods where overtime will be required, which the employee will need to comply with in order to meet the demands of the position.


**Travel Requirements** - This position requires up to 50% local/regional travel. Less than 5% out-of-area and overnight travel may be required.



THIS JOB DESCRIPTION IS SUBJECT TO CHANGE AND DOES NOT CONSTITUTE A CONTRACT FOR EMPLOYMENT OR A GUARANTEE OF CONTINUED EMPLOYMENT



At Rimkus, we value a diverse and inclusive workplace where all employees feel valued and respected. We are committed to creating a work environment that supports and celebrates the unique perspectives and experiences of all employees. If you share our commitment to diversity and inclusivity and are excited about joining a welcoming and supportive team, we encourage you to apply for our open positions.



Rimkus is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employee and will make all employment-related decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.



THIS JOB DESCRIPTION IS SUBJECT TO CHANGE AND DOES NOT CONSTITUTE A CONTRACT FOR EMPLOYMENT OR A GUARANTEE OF CONTINUED EMPLOYMENT.



#LI-SL1



#LI-REMOTE

  

Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities


The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

title: Civil Engineer
description:
PGH Wong Engineering, Inc. has a proud and lengthy history of creating innovation from challenging, complex projects. From our origin as a small system consulting firm in 1985 in San Francisco, California, PGH Wong is now a full-service engineering and architecture consulting firm for public and private entities across the nation.

  


**Responsibilities include but are not limited to the following:**

  

* Attend design review and interface coordination meetings with the Contractor and local agencies.
* Participate in meetings to discuss design submittals and reconcile review comments.
* Provide review comments to engineering reports, right-of-way maps, and design submittals.
* Assist in the coordination of the project-level design variation process and program-level variations being evaluated by others.
* Prepare design change orders in coordination with the Change Management group.
* Assist in the review of the Contractor’s monthly payment requests for reasonableness of design activity progress.
* Assist in the review and respond to the Design-Builder’s request for information (RFIs).
* Provide updates, monitor, and track design submittal, RFI, and change order logs.
* Assist in the review and evaluate design change order cost proposals and provide recommendations.
* Provide input to the PCM’s bi-weekly and monthly reports and actively participate in coordination meetings.
* Process design submittals to OSFM. Monitor and track submittals.
* Perform other duties as assigned.

  


**Qualifications and Experience:**

  

* Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering or a closely related field is preferred.
* 5+ years of experience in civil engineering with an emphasis on transportation infrastructure.
* Transportation civil & bridge design and construction management experience is a plus.
* Caltrans or Local Public Works Agency experience is desirable.
* Excellent oral and written communication skills.
* Excellent interpersonal and analytical skills.
* Demonstrated success at building team relationships and partnerships across organizational lines.

  


*We are an equal opportunity employer, dedicated to a policy of non-discrimination in employment on any basis including race, color, sex, gender, age, disability, religion, national origin, political belief, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, domestic partner status, marital status, disability, weight, height, or AIDS/HIV status.*

title: Engineer, Planning
description:
**Engineer, Planning**  

Headquartered in Phoenix, EPCOR USA owns, operates and builds water, wastewater and natural gas infrastructure and is among the largest private water utilities in the Southwest and the largest private, regulated utility in Arizona and New Mexico. EPCOR USA provides service to more than 360,000 people in 37 communities and 15 counties across three states. In addition to delivering regulated water and wastewater service to more than 350,000 people in Arizona and New Mexico and wholesale water services to municipalities in the Austin metropolitan area, EPCOR USA delivers natural gas service to customers north of the Houston metropolitan area. EPCOR USA is an indirect, wholly owned subsidiary of EPCOR Utilities Inc.  

Our mission in Planning is to help EPCOR understand their current systems and anticipate their future needs. The Engineers and GIS Professionals in Planning use asset data, operations trends, SCADA, engineering analysis, cartographic mapping, and infographics to analyze, develop, and communicate responsible long-term project recommendations for EPCOR’S 10-year capital improvement program.  

Reporting to our Phoenix, AZ Corporate Office, the successful candidate will work in a dynamic team environment to develop and maintain the 10-year long-term capital improvement program (CIP) recommendations for a variety of assigned water, wastewater, reclaimed, and non-potable systems that EPCOR owns and operates. Remote work opportunities are available for qualified individuals after completing 90 days of employment.  

**Key** **Accountabilities:*** To manage consultants to complete comprehensive planning studies (CPSs) to proactively identify capital projects needed to sustain and supply organic growth within existing service territories.
* Perform technical analyses related to demand/loading projections, infrastructure reliability & replacement, water quality trends, and operational optimization. Complete cost estimates and conceptual/planning level design of water/wastewater infrastructure.
* Work in a team environment and facilitate stakeholder consensus.

 **Requirements:*** **Education**: 4-year degree in Civil Engineering, or a related technical degree. Coursework in water/wastewater distribution and collections systems or facilities is a plus.
* **Certifications & Licenses**: Registration as an Engineer in Training (EIT), Professional Engineer in the State of Arizona is a plus; ADEQ Operator Certification is a plus.
* **Experience**: Entry-level, 0-5 years of engineering/operations experience a plus
* **Knowledge**: Strong Computer skills in Microsoft Office; Excel, Word, and PowerPoint required. Familiarity with Power BI, ArcGIS Pro, or hydraulic modeling software a plus.
* **Skills**: Ability to organize, interpret, and analyze data. Ability to use independent judgment and exercise discretion; problem solve; prioritize and multi-task. Ability to communicate clearly and concisely. Possess excellent organizational and time-management skills.
* **Physical Requirements**: Frequent sitting and standing in office/desk while operating a computer; frequent speaking; use of a headset; driving; and occasionally lifting up to 15 pounds. Periodic outdoor field visits to various EPCOR operating sites requiring company provided safety PPE. Occasional out of area travel to remote Arizona systems or to out of state systems.

  

If you’re looking to build a career with a company that values its employees’ unique skills, talents, work styles and diverse experiences, EPCOR is the place for you. We offer:* competitive salaries and an incentive award program for all employees,
* comprehensive benefits package including health, dental, vision, life insurance and disability,
* competitive vacation package that encourages a healthy work/life balance,
* training opportunities including tuition reimbursement and certification support, and,
* safe and supportive work environment
* Where We Work Program – a hybrid remote program once initial training has been completed.

  

To learn more about us and apply for this position, visit our website: www.epcor.com. Be sure to attach your current resume and a cover letter, including salary requirements.

title: Civil Engineer, PE - Remote
description:
**Civil Engineer, PE - Remote**

Discover your full potential. At Tetra Tech, we are collaborating with industry-leading experts for a sustainable future for our world. We combine consulting and engineering with advanced analytics and technology to solve the world’s most complex challenges. Our innovation hubs across the globe will enable you to share ideas and best practices while growing your professional network. Wherever you are in your career journey, you will benefit from working with world-class engineers, scientists, and technical specialists.

Apply today and join the company that is Leading with Science®. This is a REMOTE opportunity.

Tetra Tech's High-Performance Building is hiring a Civil Engineer. The successful candidate for this position will be responsible for providing civil engineering design. Typical projects include a wide variety of federal, industrial and commercial projects involving site layout and design, stormwater management, green infrastructure and water/wastewater collection and conveyance systems.

**Your Responsibilities will Include:**

* Working with project teams to create land development plans for our commercial, industrial and federal clients.
* Modeling water systems, design pump stations, force main sizing, and water tower designs.
* Performing water resources engineering and modeling for surface water management systems and stormwater collection/conveyance systems.
* Planning and designing water/wastewater/stormwater treatment, facilities/distribution/conveyance, pumping, and storage facilities projects;
* Producing green infrastructure and low-impact development stormwater design and hydraulic analysis.

**Required Qualifications**:

* Bachelor’s degree in civil engineering (or a related field).
* Professional Engineer license.
* 7+ years of experience.
* Experience in stormwater, water system and pump station hydraulic modeling.
* Experience and knowledge in commercial or industrial site development.
* Experience in Autodesk Storm and Sanitary Analysis.
* Proficiency in AutoCAD/Civil 3D.
* Position open to U.S. citizens or lawful permanent residents.

About Tetra Tech:

Tetra Tech combines the resources of a global, multibillion-dollar company with local, client-focused delivery in more than 550 locations around the world. Our reputation rests on the technical expertise and dedication of our employees—27,000 associates working together to provide smart, scalable solutions for challenging projects. We are proud to be home to leading technical experts in water, environment, infrastructure, resource management, energy, and international development.

Explore our open positions at https://www.tetratech.com/careers. Follow us on social media to learn more about our people, culture, and opportunities:

LinkedIn: @TetraTechCareers

Twitter: @TetraTechJobs

Facebook: @TetraTechCareers

**Tetra Tech** is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. Diversity, inclusion, and equity are among Tetra Tech’s core values. Throughout our history, the company has prioritized equitable inclusion of all people. All qualified candidates will be considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, military or veteran status, gender, age, disabilities, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy and pregnancy-related conditions, genetic information and any other characteristics protected by the law. We invite resumes from all interested parties. Please visit our website at www.tetratech.com to see the array of diverse services and exciting projects we are currently working on.

Tetra Tech is a VEVRAA federal contractor and we request priority referral of veterans for available positions.

We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.

**Please no phone calls or agencies.**

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $70,000.00 - $100,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Professional development assistance

Application Question(s):

Work Location: Remote

title: Structural Engineer
description:
**Job Description**

Restore Consulting LLC is looking for a STRUCTURAL RESTORATION ENGINEER in Michigan. This position is fully remote with a flexible schedule and located in either Grand Rapids, Ann Arbor, or Detroit.

Job duties include engineering relative to evaluating and restoring existing structures in Michigan and across the US. Types of structures include parking structures, industrial buildings, building facades, plazas, pedestrian bridges, and stadiums. Enjoy working in a small growing company with remote staff and a great, professional culture. Opportunity for growth. Salary Compensation is dependent on education, licensing, and experience. Minimum one (1) year of experience.

**Key Responsibilities**

* Evaluating existing structures for structural condition and repair needs.
* Develop cost estimates/budgets for restoration.
* Write physical condition assessment reports.
* Design and develop restoration drawings and specifications including structural analysis as required.
* Provide construction administration during restoration including shop drawing and construction site review.
* Perform design document review/construction site visits/testing on building enclosures of new buildings.

**Skills Needed**

* Strong verbal and written communication skills.
* Effective interpersonal skills to work with team members and clients.
* Strong organizational and time management skills.
* Superior problem-solving skills.

· Ability to work independently and effectively remote with limited supervision.

· High level of integrity and self-initiative.

· Ability to work well with others to meet deadlines.

* Experience with structural engineering analysis programs.
* Proficient in Word, Excel and Outlook.
* Working understanding of AutoCAD.
* Knowledge of materials including concrete, steel, masonry, timber, waterproofing materials and building enclosure components.
* Training will be provided in skill or experience areas that the candidate does not have.

**Job Type:** Full-Time

**Pay:** Competitive Salary dependent on education, licensing, and experience.

**Benefits:**

* Comprehensive Benefits Program including Medical, Dental, Short/Long Term Disability, PTO, Paid Holidays
* Matching Retirement Program
* Bonus Pay Opportunities
* Professional Team Atmosphere
* Remote Position
* Flexible Schedule
* Opportunity to Travel

**Physical setting:**

* Remote: Michigan – Grand Rapids, Ann Arbor, Detroit

**Requirements:**

* Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering with Structural Engineering concentration. Master's degree in Structural Engineering is a plus.
* Minimum 1 year experience preferred.
* Structural and/or restoration experience a plus.
* Professional Engineer (PE) license or ability to work toward licensure required.
* Authorized to work in the U.S. on a full-time basis.
* Ability/willingness to travel.
* Experience in structural design, property condition assessments, building facades, historical buildings, roofing, and drone evaluations a plus.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $65,000.00 - $80,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Paid time off
* Professional development assistance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Supplemental pay types:

* Bonus opportunities

Work Location: Remote

title: Rail Engineer IV
description:
**Who WE are:**


RailPros is a leading engineering and safety services company in the rail and transit industry. Our mission is to enhance mobility, safety, and quality of life for residents, passengers, and companies. We achieve this by providing unique services to rail and transit companies across North America. Through teamwork, continuous improvement, and a passion for excellence, we strive to understand our customers' challenges and earn their trust. Our dedication to staying updated on industry developments enables us to help our customers succeed. We are driven by a shared goal of keeping America moving and ensuring customer satisfaction.

  



**Keywords:** #Railway, #CivilEngineer, #Transportation, #RailPros, #Infrastructure, #TrackDesign, #ConstructionManagement, #Railroad, #Engineering, #ProjectManagement, #RailwayDesign, #TransportationEngineering, #RailwayConstruction, #CivilEngineering, #RailroadInfrastructure, #TrackMaintenance, #RailTransport, #RailwayOperations, #StructuralEngineering, #GeotechnicalEngineering. #FRARegulations, #RailSafety, #Class1Railroads, #Certification, #RailwayStandards, #TrackInspection, #RailroadMaintenance, #SafetyStandards, #TransportationSafety, #RailwayDesignStandards, #FRACompliance, #RailwayMaintenance, #RailwayInfrastructureDesign, #TrackSafety, #RailroadOperations, #CertifiedEngineer, #RailwaySafety, #FRAStandards, #Class1Railways.

**Job Summary:**


As a Rail Engineer IV, you will play a crucial role in supporting the design and development of rail infrastructure. Your experience and leadership will be instrumental in ensuring the success of our rail projects, from concept through construction. You will work with clients, collaborate with interdisciplinary teams, and contribute to the delivery of high-quality rail solutions. You will independently apply techniques and procedures in accordance with established criteria to perform assigned tasks. This position performs routine technical work that requires previous experience.

 **Essential Duties & Responsibilities:**

* **CAD Design:** Utilize Computer-Aided Design (CAD) software to create detailed drawings, plans, and layouts for rail infrastructure and other related components.
* **Technical Expertise:** Apply your knowledge of rail design principles to solve complex engineering challenges. This includes developing detailed construction cost estimates and project specifications.
* **Technical Support:** Collaborate with rail engineers to provide technical support in the development of rail projects, ensuring design meets quality and client standards.
* **Data Analysis:** Collect and analyze data relevant to rail projects.
* **Collaboration:** Work closely with cross-functional teams, including engineers and project managers to ensure seamless project execution and compliance with design requirements.
* **Quality Assurance:** Participate in quality assurance and quality control activities to ensure designs are error-free and meet client standards.
* **Mentorship:** Act as a mentor to junior engineers and designers, providing guidance and support to promote their professional growth.
* Other duties assigned or required to meet the business needs

 **Required Education and Experience:**

* Bachelor’s degree in engineering from an ABET/EAC accredited program
* 4+ years prior experience needed

**Preferred Education and Experience:**

* Master’s degree or equivalent
* Engaged in life-long learning to maintain knowledge of contemporary issues
* Experience producing drawings with CAD software

 **Additional Qualifications, Certifications, etc.:**

* Professional Engineer (PE)

 **Supervisory Responsibilities:**

* Assign tasks to and direct engineers, designers, and administrative staff
* Plan and coordinate detailed aspects of the engineering work
* Prepare scopes, budgets, and schedules for assignments
* Assist with proposals to provide professional services

**Why RailPros:**

* **Exciting Projects:** RailPros is known for working on exciting and innovative engineering projects within the rail industry, providing engineers with the opportunity to work on challenging and impactful assignments.
* **Professional Growth:** RailPros offers a conducive environment for professional growth and development, providing opportunities for engineers to expand their skills and expertise within the rail engineering field.
* **Collaborative Culture:** RailPros fosters a collaborative and team-oriented culture, providing engineers with the chance to work alongside talented professionals and contribute to a supportive work environment.
* **Industry Reputation:** RailPros has a strong reputation within the rail engineering sector, offering engineers the chance to be part of a well-respected and established company with a track record of successful projects and client satisfaction.

 **Benefits / Perks:**

* Comprehensive Health Insurance (Medical, Dental, Vision)
* Accident Plan, Critical Illness Plan, Hospital Indemnity (Employee to Family Coverage)
* Life and Disability Insurance Coverage (Employer Paid, plus Voluntary Options)
* Retirement Savings Plans (401(k) with Employer Match)
* Paid Time Off (Paid Time Off, Holidays)
* Wellness Programs
* Discount Programs
* Company-funded allowance for merchandise in our on-line store
* Health Savings Accounts (HSA) with Employer Match
* Health Reimbursement Arrangement (HRA) – Employer Funded
* Flexible Spending Accounts - Dependent Care (FSA)
* Employee Assistance Programs (EAP)
* Professional Development and Training Opportunities
* Work-Life Balance Initiatives

  

Join RailPros for a fulfilling career in a thriving and stable industry. Our core values drive us to excel as a team, prioritize customer satisfaction, and adapt to industry changes swiftly. Be part of a passionate and dedicated team that values continuous improvement, trust, and problem-solving. Apply now for an opportunity to contribute to our success.

title: Traffic Engineer
description:
PRIME AE Group, Inc. (www.primeeng.com), a multi-faceted and rapidly growing architectural and engineering firm with 20 office locations and over 475 employees throughout the Midwest, Mid-Atlantic, Southeast, and Northeast areas, is seeking a qualified candidate to serve as a **Traffic Engineer** work remotely or in one of our Transportation offices (Baltimore, Columbus, Jacksonville, Tampa, Lexington, Harrisburg, Fairfax, or Richmond).

 **Position Overview:**


The primary focus of this role will be to perform traffic engineering design for our diverse clientele which includes MDOT SHA, MDTA, DDOT, VDOT and various jurisdictions in Virginia.

 **Primary Responsibilities**:


Traffic Studies:

* Perform Crash analysis and safety studies.
* Perform Corridor and intersection analysis.
* Develop traffic signal timing and phasing.
* Conduct traffic signal warrant studies and roundabout analysis.
* Perform capacity analysis and congestion mitigation.
* Perform queueing analysis.
* Assist with developer plan review and traffic impact analysis review.
* Develop maintenance of traffic alternatives analysis.
* Perform computer software modeling and simulation.
* Prepare Traffic Engineering Reports.

  

Traffic Design:

* Conduct traffic control device inventory and design.
* Design work zone traffic control.
* Assist with development of improvement concepts.
* Develop project deliverables including plans, specifications and cost estimates.

 **Minimum Requirements**:

* Bachelor’s degree in civil engineering required. Master’s degree preferred.
* EIT certification is required. PE licensure and PTOE certification are preferred
* At least 5 years of experience in traffic engineering in a professional setting.
* EIT required; PE preferred or ability to obtain within 6 months.
* Experience working with MicroStation and/or AutoCAD.
* Ability to handle multiple assignments concurrently.
* Ability to analyze complex traffic issues and alternates and prepare cogent recommendations.
* Experience in the design of traffic control devices including signing, pavement markings, traffic signals and temporary traffic control devices.
* Familiarity with AASHTO, MUTCD, Highway Capacity Manual, Highway Safety Manual and ADA regulations.
* Experience working on traffic engineering projects for Maryland Department of Transportation State Highway Administration (MDOT – SHA) preferred.
* Strong oral and technical writing skills preferred.
* Proficieny in the use of traffic modeling including Synchro/SimTraffic, CORSIM, and HCS preferred.

  


PRIME AE Group is committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, or Veteran s

title: Field Engineer I (Entry-Level/Utilities Construction)
description:
Overview:

Henkels & McCoy West, LLC (“HW”), a MasTec subsidiary, is a full-service engineering and construction company providing utility infrastructure solutions to its government and commercial customers. HW service offerings include Consulting & Planning, Engineering & Design, Construction Management, EPC/Design Build, Program Management, and extensive Field Construction Services. HW is a utility construction firm providing critical infrastructure for North America's Power, Oil & Gas Pipeline, Gas Distribution, and Communications markets. HW is also a founding member of the ET&D Partnership, a collaborative industry partnership working to reduce fatalities, injuries, and illnesses in the construction industry is currently recruiting a Field Engineer I for our San Diego, CA location.
Responsibilities:

The Field Engineer I assists in ensuring construction project activities comply with company and contract requirements and supports the overall project schedule by providing technical support for construction, including participation in planning, execution, quality control, and completion of the work. This role also assists in ensuring compliance with the Henkels & McCoy established Project Management Methodology and upholds H&M safety and quality management protocols.  

The Field Engineer I will contribute to the management of overall project performance and assist in identifying potential stakeholder conflicts. They are responsible for communicating project risks to the PM as they arise and assisting in the development of appropriate risk mitigation steps. This role contributes to the management of overall project performance.  

Additionally, the Field Engineer I aids in ensuring that team goals, roles, protocols, and business relationships are consistent with high-performance requirements and congruent with the company's strategy. The ideal candidate will lead by example in an environment that fosters trust and candor, will maintain personal accountability, and will communicate assertively and constructively.
Qualifications:
* Exposure to construction or utility industry
* Experienced in MS Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
* Varied to Broad problem-solving skills


Minimum Educational Background:
BS degree in Project Management, Construction Management, Engineering, Business and/or equivalent years of experience

Minimum Years of Relevant Experience:
0-2  

Wage Range: $48,500 - $85,000 annually  

Benefits:
Full-time employees are eligible to participate in our benefit plan which includes the following:* 401(k) Plan
* Employee Stock Purchase Plan
* Health, Dental, & Vision Insurance
* Voluntary Life Insurance
* Short Term & Long-Term Disability
* Paid accrued vacation (2-3 weeks depending on experience)
* Up to 48 hours paid sick per year
* Up to 8.5 paid holidays per year

title: Project Manager/Civil or Environmental Engineer
description:
SC&A is seeking an experienced Project Manager with a civil or environmental engineering background. Candidates must be US Citizens, live in the United States, and have at least 10 years of experience with at least five years of experience managing projects with a budget of more than $5 million. The ideal candidate should have an M.S. in Civil or Environmental Engineering and have a P.E. Experience should include the planning, design, and construction oversight of lead pipe replacement and experience with emerging contaminants such as PFAS. The proposed candidate should have a demonstrated ability to effectively manage, coordinate, and communicate progress and any problems on the financial aspects of the work.


Additional Responsibilities:

* Participate in site visits, data collection, and investigations regarding environmental topics.
* Review technical/program documents and applications.
* Perform environmental calculations based on provided methodologies.
* Communicate with regulators on compliance issues
* Interact with clients
* Up to 30% travel required


Requirements

* US Citizen
* Ability to handle information confidentially


SC&A is an employee-owned company with headquarters in Arlington, VA and offices in Chapel Hill, NC and Germantown, MD. The company provides environmental and energy consulting services to the federal government, other government agencies, and commercial clients.


Our employees enjoy a work culture that promotes teamwork and a focus on client satisfaction.


SC&A benefits include medical, dental, short and long-term disability, basic personal accident insurance, access to a 529 saving plan, and basic life insurance. New full-time employees accrue a minimum of 15 days of paid time off (PTO) per year (number of days is dependent on years of experience) and the company recognizes 11 holidays. Employees are eligible for a 401K and a profit-sharing plan that typically provides an amount equal to 5% of your salary directly into your 401K account. The company benefits are effective on your first day of employment.

***SC&A does not accept third-party applications or agency inquiries. Phone calls are not accepted for any position.*** *Job descriptions are not intended as and do not create employment contracts. SC&A maintains its status as an at-will employer. Employees can be terminated for any reason not prohibited by law. Candidates are required to pass a background screening prior to employment.*

title: EV Civil Engineer
description:
**About SEAM Group:**
SEAM Group is an ***innovative global leader in safety, reliability, and maintenance services***. Our focus and dedication to ***creating a safer, more reliable world*** has earned us top recognition as award winners for both **Inc 5000** and **NorthCoast 99**. By emphasizing values such as ***teamwork, trust, respect, and support***, we have built an unparalleled ***people-first culture***. Through leveraging innovative technologies and a commitment to excellence, we combine our employees’ unique talents and individualities to build the best solutions both within our organization and for our customers.

**About our Role:**
Join our Renewable Energy Department as **Electric Vehicle (EV) Civil Engineer** who wants to make a difference by ensuring safety for the lives of many others. You will join Electric Vehicle Operations Team and report to the Director of Design and Engineering Services. As a Civil Engineer, you will focus on Electric Vehicle Infrastructure designs with a heavy site due diligence, site layouts, code requirements, EVSE equipment requirements, EVSE owner/operator specific design requirements as well as all other aspects of site stormwater, utility design, and/or building projects and construction. You will also have the opportunity to work on other engineering projects supporting other departments within the SEAM Group portfolio.  

  

***\\*\\*This opportunity is remote-friendly (work from home).***  

  

**As our EV Civil Engineer, you are responsible for:**
* Responsible for due diligence, investigating local requirements and criteria, verifying client-provided information is accurate
* CAD design/drafting
* GIS knowledge
* Ability to support the Project Managers and other team members as necessary to produce the project.
* Under the direction and supervision of other Engineers be able to prepare EV infrastructure layouts to include consideration of ADA compliance, code requirement, and drainage and Utility plans for land development and infrastructure projects.
* Responsible for plan production and accurate implementation of specific EVSE standards
* Trains Staff Engineers or other Project Engineers on design software, calculations, and design concepts
* Assist with applications for all necessary regulatory permits.
* Assist with the prepare calculations and reports relating to project submittals.
* Help the team manage project schedules to achieve project milestones and deliverable work products.
* Provide assistance with project bidding and construction administration phases.
* Work cooperatively on project teams.
* Ability to independently solve problems
* Responsible for checking work as well as other engineers’ designs and calculations, to ensure alignment to quality assurance and control requirements
* Actively participates in and contributes to department and project team meetings and discussions
* Collaborates with project manager and others to develop and implement design strategies
* Assist with project management duties, as requested and needed


  

**Successful candidates will have the following education and experience:**
* You have obtained an Engineering degree from an accredited school or university
* PE certification highly desired
* 5+ years of experience working as a Civil Engineer
* Must be able to pass a criminal background check and a drug screening
* 2+ years of Electric Vehicle experience


  

SEAM Group is an equal opportunity employer and is dedicated to diversity and inclusion in our workforce. All employment decisions are made based on qualifications, merit, and business need. EEO/M/F/D/V. SEAM Group is an e-verify employer. Qualified candidates for this role must be authorized to work in the U.S. At this time, SEAM Group does not sponsor work visas.

title: Structural Engineer-Work Remotely, Some Travel
description:
We are seeking structural engineers to join our growing team in an exciting and new culture of consulting. Our vision for SSI is to provide professionals a means to be a part of something bigger, grow themselves, and make a positive, tangible impact in our clients' operations. We offer a flexible, remote, work environment, meeting only if / when needed for specific projects.

SSI engineers will work with other team members and clients on large, multidiscipline projects in the bulk material handling world. This is a chance to enter a niche market, learning design skills few in the world have, and to work with experts with decades of experience that are looking to mentor.

Also, you'll have the opportunity to perform inspections at industrial / bulk material handling facilities, as well as design repairs based findings from those inspections. Being part of the group to help a client execute their long term operational goals is satisfying, and we often play a critical role in establishing future maintenance/repair projects.

We have a need for experienced engineers who also can autonomously manage design and inspection projects. The ideal candidate can self manage, while working well with others, and can be an advocate for SSI and our services while working directly with clients. While major industries served include the cement and grain industry, we often work with materials from roofing granules to plastic pellets. Our scope of services routinely includes working at heights and permit required confined space entry into material storage silos. Inspectors must be able to perform duties at elevation and maintain clear focus. Roles and responsibilities of the position include:

* Has the ability to read and understand construction documents and comprehend critical information necessary for data collection during and after the inspection.
* Observe various structures/silo types [concrete and steel] in the field and perceive structural deficiencies.
* Has the ability to collect accurate measurements and representative photos during an inspection and record concise notes of the observations.
* Inspectors will be required to perform inspections from personnel lifts or from cable rigging on material storage silos.
* Inspections often include interior confined space entry within a silo to observe structural elements.
* Collaborate with facility personnel to establish inspection objectives and provide guidance to rigging sub-consultants for completion of scheduled tasks.
* Ability to establish and maintain positive relationships with clients while onsite and effectively describe field observations in produced reports.
* Can write a detailed technical report that describes the history of the structure, inspection methods utilized, observations, and conclusions and recommendations for future use. Technical reports will generally agree with SSI standards for deliverables; however the inspector will be responsible for the uniquely descriptive content. Above average technical report writing experience is appreciated.
* Perform analysis, work with designers for development of design level repair drawings for observed deficiencies during inspections.
* Design engineering experience in reinforced concrete, structural steel, masonry, wood is applicable.
* Has the ability to work alongside SSI’s design department to successfully direct drawing progress and complete code compliant structural drawings.
* Out-of-state travel to inspection sites can range between 1-2 weeks per month, depending on workload and performance.

Qualifications: While the following is a list of qualifications for this position, they should not prohibit someone interested in the role from applying. These are intended to provide a better understanding of the role.

* Ability to manage several projects concurrently
* Proficiency in technical report writing. Strong communication skills are required in the form of written and verbal modes. The ideal candidate must be capable of effectively communicating with internal and external stakeholders.
* Experience and understanding of the following design codes: ACI, AISC, IBC
* Applicable Certifications: MSHA Miner Training (form 5000-23) Part 46 and 48, OSHA 10, Confined Space Entry Training
* Professional Engineer (PE) registration or ability to obtain is a must.
* Ability to interface and perform in a team-based environment as well as can accomplish tasks independently.
* Willingness to meet client schedules and project deadlines.
* Proficient in the use of RISA, Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook, and AutoCAD.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Contract

Pay: $100,000.00 - $135,200.00 per year

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule

Compensation package:

* Bonus opportunities

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Experience:

* Bulk Material Handling Design: 5 years (Preferred)

License/Certification:

* Professional Engineering License (Preferred)

Willingness to travel:

* 25% (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

title: Project Engineer - Remote
description:
**What is the Opportunity?**


At Ovivo, we offer you the opportunity to expand your skills and professional experience while collaborating with worldwide experts in water treatment. As a Project Engineer with the PFAS Solutions team, you are responsible for managing the technical aspects of assigned projects, performing the engineering and design work required within the budget allocated to meet the requirements of customer specifications.

  

The role is based in our Salt Lake City Office and will enjoy our hybrid working model.


Expected domestic travel is 10-40%.

 **What is the role?**

* Manage the mechanical technical aspects within a multi-disciplinary team for the development and commercialization of effective and safe products for the treatment of per-and polyfluoroalkyl substances (PFAS).
* Establish appropriate design methods, sizing, and costing programs in coordination with other engineer disciplines.
* Check calculations, models, layouts, detailed drawings, specifications, and instructions prepared by drafters/designers and other engineers.
* Ability to read and understand fabrication, erection, and standard engineering drawings.
* Communicate directly with the customer together with the project manager to resolve technical issues.
* Direct the execution of design project and provide technical support to shop and field start-up services.
* Document and update design procedures on a regular basis.
* Advises project engineers, project managers and/ or other managers on project status.
* Conducts quality control and quality assurance tests and ensures designs are compliant with the clients' technical requirements and budget(s).
* Assists in marketing business opportunities with key clients and development of responses to RFP/RFQs.
Travels to the project site to conduct project-related tasks; provides timely responses to managers and clients on project tasks  
* 

  

**Does this sound like you?**

* Bachelor's degree in Civil and Environmental, Mechanical, Industrial, Chemical or Process Engineering from an accredited university.
* 8-10+ years of engineering-related experience in water/wastewater industry.
* Professional Engineering Registration preferred (CPEng, RPEQ, or equivalent).
* Knowledge of electrical, instrumentation, SCADA, structural and architectural discipline along with working knowledge of AutoCAD.
* Ability to apply advanced mathematical equations to complex situations.

 **Don't meet every single requirement? If you carry a strong sense of ownership and teamwork in everything you do, we'd like to hear from you any way.**

 **Why work at Ovivo?**

* Medical, Dental and Vision benefits
* 401k Match
* Company paid life insurance along with company paid short and long-term disability
* 11 paid holidays
* Three weeks of PTO to start (hire date determines number of PTO hours for the first year)
* Roll over of 40 PTO hours to the following year
* Sixteen personal hours (hire date determines number of personal hours for the first year)
* Days off between Christmas Eve and New Year's Day - paid by the company with no impact to PTO balance.
* Profit sharing

  

At Ovivo we are committed to providing working environments where everyone is included and treated fairly and with respect.


Dive in - Apply Today! Let's change the future of water together.

 **About Ovivo**


Ovivo is a global provider of equipment, technology, and systems producing among the purest water and treating some of the most challenging wastewater in the industry. Ovivo is a powerful global brand with renowned trademarks, possessing more than 150 years of expertise and references in water treatment, supported by its proprietary products, advanced technologies, and extensive system integration knowhow. Ovivo delivers conventional to highly technological water treatment solutions for the industrial and municipal markets and leverages its large installed base of equipment around the world to offer parts and services to its customers. Ovivo is dedicated to innovation in an industry that is in constant evolution and offers water treatment solutions that are cost-effective, energy-efficient, and environmentally sustainable.


Visit our website to learn more about Ovivo: https://careers.ovivowater.com/

title: Engineering Subject Matter Expert
description:
PDHengineer.com is looking for qualified engineers to present webinars and write courses for our online continuing education platform. THIS IS A REMOTE POSITION THAT CAN BE PERFORMED FROM YOUR OWN HOME OR OFFICE.

This is a part-time position as an independent contractor. There is no minimum time commitment.

**WEBINAR INSTRUCTOR**

Presenting webinars is a great way to develop a substantial side revenue stream without a large investment of time. Share your knowledge in a lively discussion-based format from the comfort of your own home or office.

The video component of the webinar is distributed over the internet using a PowerPoint presentation. Audio is delivered to webinar participants using either a phone line or their computer’s built-in audio. You simply make the live presentation just as if you were in front of the audience. The webinar attendees can ask questions and interact with you at all times.

We offer flexible scheduling of webinars to fit your calendar.

You are responsible for creating the PowerPoint slides for your presentation. You will be paid $125/hour for every hour of live instruction you provide during the webinars.

Additionally, if you wish, your presentations can be recorded and published on our website to serve as the content for self-study courses. You will be paid a royalty each time your self-study course is purchased by one of our customers. (See the description below for COURSE AUTHOR.)

**COURSE AUTHOR**

Write course(s) in Microsoft Word format (or record videos) at your own pace and email them to us. Then sit back and earn royalties while we do all the work. Our team will handle the formatting and publication of your courses. You earn a royalty payment on every sale generated by your courses.

These are self-study courses. You are not required to teach in front of a live audience. After submitting a course for publication on our website, your work is done.

After your course is published, it is available online for engineers to purchase and complete. You continue to earn royalties from your courses year after year – without having to do any additional work.

AS A COURSE AUTHOR, THERE IS NO GUARANTEED AMOUNT OF COMPENSATION. You will receive compensation only when your courses are purchased by our customers.

Although there’s no guaranteed amount of compensation, some of our most prolific course authors collect more than $50,000 in royalty payments every year without doing any additional work. Their recurring income is realized solely from courses they created years ago.

Skills/Experience:  
Must be highly knowledgeable and experienced on the topic of your course or webinar presentation.

Must have at least a Bachelor’s degree in Engineering or a related field from an accredited university and a minimum of 7 years’ experience practicing as an engineer post-graduation (Registered Professional Engineers are strongly preferred)

Duties and Schedule:

There are no employment benefits associated with this position.

There is no set work schedule associated with this position. As a course author, you can work at your own pace. As a webinar instructor, we’ll work with you to schedule your webinars on dates/times that are amenable to you.

Compensation for course authors will be royalty-based at an agreed-upon rate. Income will vary depending on course popularity and the volume of courses published.

Compensation for presenting a webinar will be $125/hour for every hour of live instruction you provide during the webinars.

Course Topics:  
Webinar instructors and course authors with knowledge and experience in all the following areas are needed:  
Renewable Energy  
Engineering Ethics  
Civil Engineering  
Mechanical Engineering  
Concrete  
Electrical Engineering  
Structural Engineering  
Geotechnical Engineering  
Stormwater  
Piping and Valve Design and Selection  
Energy Conservation  
Forensic Engineering and Failure Appraisement  
Fire Protection  
Building Systems Design (HVAC, Electrical, Plumbing)  
Sustainable Design  
LEED topics  
Green Engineering

Retired engineers are welcome.

About PDHengineer.com / Decatur Professional Development:

Founded in 2003, Decatur Professional Development has helped tens of thousands of professional engineers fulfill their state-mandated continuing education requirements through online courses, correspondence courses, webinars and seminars. Decatur Professional Development’s continuing education products are available on the website PDHengineer.com.

You can find more information here: https://www.pdhengineer.com/write-course/.

* Engineering: 4 years (Required)

title: Project Manager (PM)
description:
**Title:** Project Manager (PM)

  


**Location:** Remote

  


**Role:** The PM will lead an interdisciplinary team that creates and updates digital and paper-based courses used by Air Force personnel who serve in the civil engineer career field. The PM is responsible for managing the work according to all performance criteria. The PM works with the customer and corporate assets to create and maintains the Project Management Plan, a living document which includes the Work Breakdown Structure (WBS), organizational structure of the project team, Project/Milestone Schedule, deliverables and acceptance criteria, quality control and metrics, risk assessment and mitigation, and cost reporting. The PM uses project management software to produce and maintain the project plan. The supported customer is the Air Force Civil Engineer Center at Tyndall Air Force Base in Panama City, FL. If you are looking to lead a project that will challenge and grow your talents as a PM, this role is meant for you.

  


**Duties:**


* Develop and maintain the project management plan and the plan’s associated components for managing project costs, schedule, delivery, quality, personnel, and risk.
* Manage the project team; serve as supervisor for designated staff and prepare their annual performance evaluations.
* Attend contract-specified meetings and maintain strong communications with the government’s lead.
* Create the WBS and work with APV corporate leaders to allocate resources (people, time, and tools) to accomplish every work package.
* Provide all deliverables and required reports on time in accordance with quality standards.
* Collaborate with the customer to establish appropriate metrics to monitor quality and project risks.
* Convene lessons learned meetings at critical times as part of APV’s commitment to continuous improvement.
* Participate in monthly project reviews with APV’s Program Management Office and corporate leadership.

  


**Technical:**

* Clear evidence of having used modern project management software; experience using JIRA™ is a plus.
* Comfortable using the MS Office suite of software, especially Word, PowerPoint, Excel, and SharePoint.

  


**Education:**


* Bachelor’s Degree required.

  


**Certifications:**


* Certification as a Project Management Professional.
* Other certifications or evidence of advanced training in project-relevant disciplines are a plus but are not required.

  


**Experience:**


* At least three years as Project Manager leading a team of at least 5 people, with a team size of 10 or more preferred.
* Experience with federal government contracts.
* Experience using Agile, waterfall, and hybrid project management techniques.

**Company Background:**

Since its founding in 2007, APV's portfolio of clients has grown significantly. As a well-established, woman-owned, Small Business Association-certified 8(a) company, APV has become a small business leader in supporting a multitude of clients, from more than 15 federal and state agencies, including the Department of Defense, to civilian organizations. As of , APV has executed 70 plus prime contracts and received exceptional performance and client service ratings. APV is currently working on more than 30 government projects.


APV is a mature company dedicated to quality and exceptional delivery to meet its clients’ missions. We believe that the highest quality consultants are an essential part of this. We hire the best and take care of the people who come to work for us. We continue to maintain 96% employee satisfaction and have a high retention rate, well above the industry average for our small business peers. We do this by offering a competitive compensation plan and providing leadership that is dedicated to employee growth and advancement.

title: Air Force Civil Engineer SME
description:
**Title:** Air Force Civil Engineer SME

  


**Location:** Remote

  


**Role:** The Air Force Civil Engineer SME (CE SME) is a member of a project team responsible for creating or updating online, classroom, and hybrid courses for US Air Force personnel working in the civil engineering career field. The CE SME works with instructional designers and course developers, advising them on content applicable to USAF CE disciplines. If you are looking for work that will challenge and grow your talents in new ways, this role is meant for you.

  


**Duties:**


* Attend daily and other period customer meetings focused on USAF CE force development and training. This includes interaction with the customer and APV Project Manager (PM) to identify and clarify work requirements for the contract team.
* Advise the customer on USAF CE training and force development matters; review designated existing courses to identify areas where content is outdated.
* Provide USAF CE subject matter expertise to the project team, helping the PM, instructional designers and course developers to identify applicable references containing job-specific tasks/sub-tasks, create scenarios that challenge learners, develop/proof questions for end-of-course/module exams and knowledge checks, and ensure the best CE-relevant content is integrated into all courses.
* Participate in the functional testing of courseware on the LMS’s development and learner-facing environments, as well as user/group tests of courses conducted with members of the targeted learner community.
* Help team members resolve user-reported issues with course content or functionality.
* Review user documentation on how to use the LMS(s) to access and complete the customer’s courseware. This may include contributing to creation of course-specific user guides, tutorials, and participating in training sessions for users.
* Assist with reports and analytics on user activity, course completion rates, assessment results, and other relevant metrics to assist the customer in evaluating the effectiveness of training programs and identifying areas for improvement.
* Participate in team meetings to remain abreast of project timelines and anticipate CE SME requirements.
* Perform other duties as assigned.

  


**Technical:**


* Qualifications/certification in AF CE tasks in one or more USAF Specialty Codes from 3E0 through 3E9.
* Organized and detail oriented, able to simultaneously manage multiple tasks.

  


**Education:**


* Bachelor’s Degree strongly preferred.

  


**Experience:**


* Fifteen (15) or more years of service in the USAF in the CE career field. Government civilians with relevant AF CE experience are eligible for this position.

**Company Background:**

Since its founding in 2007, APV's portfolio of clients has grown significantly. As a well-established, woman-owned, Small Business Association-certified 8(a) company, APV has become a small business leader in supporting a multitude of clients, from more than 15 federal and state agencies, including the Department of Defense, to civilian organizations. As of , APV has executed 70 plus prime contracts and received exceptional performance and client service ratings. APV is currently working on more than 30 government projects.


APV is a mature company dedicated to quality and exceptional delivery to meet its clients’ missions. We believe that the highest quality consultants are an essential part of this. We hire the best and take care of the people who come to work for us. We continue to maintain 96% employee satisfaction and have a high retention rate, well above the industry average for our small business peers. We do this by offering a competitive compensation plan and providing leadership that is dedicated to employee growth and advancement.

title: Senior Civil Engineer
description:
**JOB DESCRIPTION:**

**GENERAL SUMMARY:**

The Senior Civil Engineer will prepare and manage site development plans and specifications for commercial and industrial sites in conformance to client requirements and local ordinances. The Senior Civil Engineer will work with and advise other disciplines on site issues that may impact architectural development and building systems and develop criteria for procuring sub-consultant services.

**ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:**

* Manage and establish project scope, civil budget, design approach and applicable constraints with the Manager of Civil Engineering, Project Manager, client, and/or engineering team as appropriate.
* Prepare feasibility studies and civil cost estimates.
* Formulate design of civil systems including underground utilities, paving, grading, and drainage for medium to large scale projects of increasing complexity.
* Develop site layout(s) in accordance with zoning and other applicable ordinances and requirements.
* Edit or draft project specifications.
* Evaluate design options for consideration by Project Manager and/or client.
* Monitor project budgets and schedules. Adjust work efforts as required to meet budget and schedule goals
* Prepare working drawings for construction on CAD with support from department staff when applicable.
* Conduct field measuring and/or survey verification at project site. Perform basic topographic surveying for minor projects.
* Review drawings for omissions, errors, overall quality, content accuracy, and compliance with standards and codes.
* Review product submittals (shop drawings) for conformance with contract documents, specify action necessary for compliance.
* Prepare project file updates, transmittals, letters, reports, and other project correspondence.
* Assist with checking, standards review, and maintenance of master specifications.
* Attend meetings with governmental agencies as required for obtaining site plan approval. Ability to address public and governmental groups in open meetings is essential.
* Perform production and quality monitoring of construction documents per company standards individually and for less experienced staff.
* Coordinate project with other disciplines and advises of site/building system conflicts.
* Prepare site plan submittal documents in accordance with local requirements.
* Visit construction site to monitor progress and other duties per the contract documents.
* Develop and mentors less experienced staff.
* Develop cost and quantity estimates.
* Perform related duties as assigned.

**EMPLOYMENT QUALIFICATIONS:**

**EDUCATION:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Civil Engineering or related field
* Professional registration

**EXPERIENCE:**

* 15+ years of related experience in site design and civil engineering

**SKILLS/COMPETENCIES:**

* Advanced level proficiency in AutoCAD, Civil 3D, and Bluebeam
* Knowledge in Infraworks and BIM 360 a bonus
* Knowledge/proficiency in hydraulics and hydrology system design, state and federal environmental laws.
* Excellent written and verbal communication
* Strong attention to detail

Continuously rated a Top Workplace to Work (https://topworkplaces.com/company/ghafari-associates-l-l/freep/) , Crain’s Cool Place to Work (https://www.crainsdetroit.com/cool) , and a Best and Brightest (https://www.ghafari.com/news-and-views/ghafari-is-a-best-and-brightest-company-in-detroit-chicago-west-michigan) company to work for in the US, Ghafari has made a name for itself through our culture, employee benefits, and portfolio of projects (https://www.ghafari.com/projects) .

description:
