title: Civil / Structural Engineer | Commercial Nuclear
description:
Civil Engineer - Commercial Nuclear

Job Description:  
We are seeking an experienced and qualified Civil Engineer to join our team in the commercial nuclear industry. As a Civil Engineer, you will be responsible for the design, analysis, and construction oversight of civil structures and infrastructure within nuclear power plants. Your expertise in civil engineering principles and your knowledge of commercial nuclear regulations will be crucial in ensuring the safety and stability of these facilities.

Responsibilities:

* Design and develop civil structures and infrastructure for nuclear power plants, including buildings, foundations, containment structures, and site drainage systems.
* Conduct feasibility studies and analysis to determine the optimal civil engineering solutions for nuclear power plants.
* Collaborate with interdisciplinary teams to integrate civil engineering designs with other plant systems, such as mechanical and electrical engineering.
* Ensure compliance with commercial nuclear regulations and standards, including those set by regulatory bodies such as the Nuclear Regulatory Commission (NRC).
* Perform risk assessments and safety evaluations to identify potential civil engineering hazards and develop mitigation strategies.
* Oversee construction activities, including site preparation, excavation, and concrete placement, to ensure adherence to design specifications and quality standards.
* Conduct periodic inspections and audits to assess the condition and integrity of civil structures and infrastructure.
* Troubleshoot and resolve civil engineering issues and challenges, collaborating with operations and maintenance teams as necessary.
* Develop and maintain technical documentation, including drawings, specifications, and reports related to civil engineering designs and construction.
* Stay updated with the latest advancements in civil engineering and nuclear technology to contribute to plant improvements and upgrades.

Qualifications:

* Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering or a related field. Master's degree preferred.
* Professional Engineer (PE) license in Civil Engineering is highly desirable.
* Minimum of 3-4 years of dedicated nuclear civil engineering project experience.
* Strong knowledge of civil engineering principles, including structural analysis, geotechnical engineering, and construction materials.
* Familiarity with commercial nuclear regulations and standards, such as those set by the NRC.
* Experience in the design and construction oversight of civil structures and infrastructure, preferably in the context of nuclear power plants.
* Proficient in using civil engineering software and tools for analysis, design, and drafting.
* Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to troubleshoot and resolve civil engineering issues.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate effectively with interdisciplinary teams and contractors.
* Attention to detail and a commitment to safety and quality in all aspects of work.
* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple priorities effectively.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $90,000.00 - $120,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Professional development assistance
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Remote

title: Civil Engineer (Remote)
description:
McCall Thomas Engineering Company, Inc. is seeking an experienced full-time Substation Design Civil Engineer. This will be a remote position requiring some travel in order to attend client and internal team meetings. South Carolina candidate preferred.

  

Job location: Remote

  

Work schedule options: M-TH 4X10 or M-F 5X8

  

At McCall-Thomas Engineering we have been providing quality engineering and technical services since 1945. With a storied history of over 78 years and more than 200 clients, McCall-Thomas continues to take great pride in utilizing our experience and efficiency to provide the highest quality engineering and technical services for the ultimate success of our valued clients.

  



McCall-Thomas Engineering is a multi-faceted employee-owned engineering firm housing multiple divisions including the Communications Engineering Division, the Electrical Engineering Division, the Electric Utility Service Division, the Electric Field Operations & UAS, as well as the McT Learning Center and Print Services.

  



A McCall-Thomas Substation/Transmission (Civil) Engineer will provide civil-structural engineering and technical expertise to Transmission Line and Transmission Substation engineering and design teams for the purpose of delivering safe, cost-effective, and quality engineering and design services. The Engineer will also provide direction on complex engineering and technical challenges for the projects. This role requires both direct billable client work and project management support for projects. The Engineer is expected to take initiative on discipline-specific work for projects, perform assigned engineering duties and manage project schedules and budgets. The Engineer will also support proposal development and project cost estimating.

 **The primary responsibilities for this role include:**

  

* Understanding and creating substation civil-structural drawing packages (foundations, structural steel, bus and cable) utilizing national code, industry standards and best practices
* Identifying, analyzing, and resolving engineering, technical and design problems
* Planning, organizing, estimating, scheduling, and monitoring of work activities
* Assuming project lead responsibilities such as assigning work to other engineers and to technicians
* Producing thorough, timely, and accurate technical reports, correspondence, documentation, calculations, and sketches
* Signing and sealing drawings and reports
* Monitoring deliverables and schedules, and presenting solutions to the client
* Continually improving job-related engineering, technical and professional knowledge, skills, process development, and performance
* Representing the company positively and professionally, and developing and maintaining professional relationships with clients.
* Interacting with client’s internal engineering staff and technical personnel on a day-to-day basis


This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. The employee may be tasked with other related duties as required to meet the ongoing needs of the organization.

 **What You Will Need:**


* Eligibility to work in the US without sponsorship (required)
* Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering from an ABET-accredited engineering program
* PE registration in SC required within 120 days
* 7+ years experience in substation design (for remote work eligibility)
* Experience must include preparation of scopes of work, development of conceptual designs, determination of design basis, the selection of equipment and materials, and the preparation and assembling of calculations and specifications
* Knowledge of engineering standards including NESC, IEC, ASCE, ACI, IEEE and ANSI
* Valid driver’s license

  


**What We Offer:**



At McCall-Thomas, we offer employees the chance to work with great people on exciting projects, with opportunity for growth. We also provide a full range of benefits for regular full-time employees, such as:


* Competitive compensation
* 100% company-paid medical insurance
* Company-paid long-term disability insurance
* Company-paid life insurance
* 401k plan with employer match up to 5%
* Paid time off and holiday leave
* Stock ownership opportunities

title: Civil Engineer
description:
BJMC Global is a service-disabled, veteran-owned small business specializing in general management consulting services and facilities support services. Over the past 2 decades, we’ve designed, managed, and delivered complex, challenging projects throughout the world. From defense installations in active war zones to nuclear projects of national security importance to post-disaster recovery environments, our team of skilled professionals have been at the forefront leading the way. Our past federal government experience includes supporting DOD, DOE, NNSA, FEMA, NAVFAC, and USACE.

BJMC Global is currently seeking experienced and qualified **Civil Engineers** to support our team working on a Department of Energy (DOE) megaproject in the United States. We're looking for engineers who can overcome challenges and complete projects in any environment. This role will work closely with our engineering team and must have a working knowledge of federal (including DOE), state, and local codes and standards applicable to civil engineering design.

If you're someone who can take direction, but doesn’t always need to be told what to do, then we want to hear from you.

**RESPONSIBILITIES:**

- Generate designs related to water distribution systems, water supply, sewage collection, distribution, and treatment, grading and drainage, and pavement evaluation and design.

- Generate and review the accuracy of design/evaluation calculations, specifications, while engaged in the planning, design, and construction phases of engineering projects.

- Generate and review the accuracy of design/evaluation calculations, and specifications. Estimating and budgeting support.

- Familiarity with computer aided drafting applications is required.

- Plan, organize, and coordinate civil engineering and multi-disciplined team/design projects while engaged in the planning, design and construction phases of engineering projects.

- Conduct construction document reviews.

- Provide technical direction to assigned engineers.

**QUALIFICATIONS:**

- Must be U.S. Citizen.

- Bachelor of Science in Civil Engineering, or equivalent degree.

- Minimum of 10 years experience in design, estimating, specification preparation, construction document preparation, and related phases of engineering.

- Professional Engineer License preferred but not required.

- Strong Understanding of Civil industrial work, ability to perform detailed layout and design of the following: Site Paving Layout and Geometry; Site Grading and Drainage; Storm Drainage Design; Erosion and Sediment Control; Stormwater Ponds; Routing of Underground Utilities (storm drain, sanitary/process sewer, firewater, water and others); Sanitary Sewer Design (gravity and pressure systems, pump stations); Preparation of Civil related Permits and Reports (NPDES/SCDHEC Stormwater and Erosion/Sediment Control; Sanitary Sewer and Potable Water).

- Advanced knowledge of modeling software (stormwater pond design, storm drainage design/pipe networks, earthwork cut and fill calculations), hydrologic analysis and hydraulic design, and preparing specifications.

**POSITION REQUIREMENTS:**

- Must be good team players and able to work well with others in pursuit of accomplishing program objectives.

- Must have excellent oral and written communication skills.

- Professional licenses and certifications are a plus.

- DOE requires that all workers on this project must be U.S. citizens.

- Must pass background investigation and drug screening.

**HOW TO APPLY**

Interested candidates should provide a current resume clearly describing relevant past experience. Our onboarding team will review your resume and if you meet the qualifications and requirements of the position, we’ll contact you to discuss next steps.

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Pay: $75.00 - $85.00 per hour

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

* Do you have a Professional Engineer (PE) License?
* Are you authorized to work on this project per the Department of Energy (DOE) requirement that all staff must be U.S. Citizens?
* Have you previously performed civil engineering for heavy industrial projects, including grading and drainage, stormwater management, and site layout?
* Which of these software programs do you have advanced proficiency: Autodesk Civil 3D, Autodesk Storm and Sanitary Analysis, Autodesk Vehicle Tracking, Hydraflow Hydrographs
* For remote position, are you willing to perform travel (fully paid) for up to two weeks per month to project office in Greenville, SC?
* Do you have a 4-Year Bachelor's Degree in Civil Engineering?

Work Location: Remote

title: Project Interface Manager (Lewiston, Maine)
description:
**General information:**


At Hitachi energy's global PEM (Project Engineering Management) office we contribute with increased customer value by visualizing, controlling and managing our delivery projects with a focus on cost, quality and time. Right now we are experiencing strong growth and are looking for a Project Interface Manager to be based at our client's site in Merrill Road, Maine.

**Your Responsibilities:**

* In this role you are responsible for identifying, managing, and controlling interfaces in one of our complex projects.
* You help to create a transparent picture of the status of our projects and give recommendations for priorities that lead to optimal progress.
* By anticipating, understanding, and influencing interfaces in the project, you have a positive impact on the project's deliveries, whether it concerns time, cost and/or quality.
* You ensure that we always have a good flow of information and communication across the project's internal as well as external interfaces.
* You work with interfaces in the Engineering part of an EPC (Engineering Procurement Construction) project.

* You enjoy working in an organization that values transparency and team work, you contribute with positive energy, innovative thinking, and a genuine commitment.
* Candidate must already have work authorization that would permit them to work for Hitachi Energy in the United States.
* You have experience of working in large complex projects, preferably civil engineering projects and you take on challenges with an innovative and problem-solving approach.
* You are confident in your leadership role and are good at creating long-term relationships, both internally within your project, within HVDC as an organization and with other external stakeholders.
* Fluency of English is required. Other languages used within the group are meritorious.

title: Civil Engineer
description:
**Summary:**  

  

Responsible for providing engineering support by completing parts of engineering projects or the entirety of less complex projects that include the entitlement and design of land development projects. Discipline involves planning, designing and building a wide variety of infrastructure improvements. This includes waterlines, storm sewer conveyance and treatment facilities, sanitary sewer conveyance system and grading.  

  

  

  

**Essential Functions:**  

  

* Design land development projects for residential, commercial and municipal development.
* Have the ability to prepare and process construction plans for approval within multiple jurisdictions.
* Prepare detailed grading, roadway, water, and sewer plans using AutoCAD Civil 3D.
* Complete hydrology and hydraulic analysis, drainage reports, and storm drain design including detention and water quality facilities.
* Prepare supporting calculations, construction specs, and permitting in various jurisdictions.
* Prepare scope, schedule and budget parameters.
* Communicate as appropriate to director of development services and project team concerning questions, concerns, progress and results.
* Assign tasks to and coordinate with entry level engineers and designers.
* Assist with proposals, contracts and client management.
* Perform business development activities through maintenance of positive client relationships.
* Supervise interns as needed.

  

  

  

  

**Competencies:**  

  

* Competency in AutoCAD Civil 3D including roadway corridors and advanced grading techniques.
* Experience with drainage software including SWMM.
* Ability to take direction and work independently as well as effectively collaborate with teams
* Verbal, written and presentation skills.
* Strong technical writing skills.
* Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite.

  

  

  

  

**Education and Experience:**  

  

* Undergraduate or graduate degree from accredited program in civil engineering.
* Professional Engineering licensure or ability to obtain PE within one year.
* Minimum of five (5) years of progressive experience with an emphasis in civil design including drainage, utility, roadway / transportation design.
* Experience writing drainage reports and performing utility design in Civil 3D.
* Valid driver's license, in conjunction with successfully passing the Company’s MVR.
* Member of professional practice organization.

  

This is a remote position.

title: Civil Designer/Civil Engineer
description:
**POSITION SUMMARY**  

  

This is a job for a motivated civil site designer that enjoys projects that make big economic and quality of life impacts on the communities the projects reside in. This position demands considerable experience with Civil 3D and a desire to take projects from start to permit in Civil 3D and a desire to be on a project management tract.  

  

**Please do not apply if you do not:*** Have significant Civil 3D experience in the production of civil site construction documents for public and private developments.
* Want to develop site civil plans in a team environment.
* If you are not self-motivated and comfortable with your growth potential within the company being tied to your performance, not your education.
* See yourself as a longer-term fit for an organization that prioritizes employee growth and advancement.

  

The position offers the ability to work in the office and remotely so long as certain objectives are met. The position includes a very attractive bonus system tied not to licensure, but rather to overall production and performance.  

  

**ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:**  

The essential functions include, but are not limited to the following:* Perform design work focused on-site planning and land development, including roadway plans and profiles, water resources, grading, earthwork analysis, specifications, and preparation of cost estimates.
* Complete diagrams, schematics, layouts, multi-view, and various drawings to scale in accordance with clients’ requests.
* Perform mathematical, geometrical, and minor engineering computations.
* Produce scale engineering drawings using CAD.
* Complete detailed design drawings and related specifications according to engineering sketches, specifications, and related data and drawings to determine design factors such as size, shape, and arrangement of parts.
* File drawings maintain catalogs of engineering data.
* Interface with clients in a professional and client-focused manner.
* Perform other work-related duties as assigned.

  

**MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS: (KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES)*** Extensive experience in Civil Site Design (Water, Sewer, Storm, Grading & Roads) (Required).
* Self-motivated, and able to work both individually and as a team member.
* Strong PC/IT skills, including Microsoft Office Suite.
* Familiarity with GA DOT standards and specifications is a plus.
* Good written and oral communication skills • Good analytical and problem-solving skills.

  

**PHYSICAL DEMANDS AND WORK ENVIRONMENT:**  

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this position. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the functions. While performing the duties of this position, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to use hands or fingers, handle or feel objects, tools, or controls. The employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; sit, and reach with hands and arms. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this position include close vision, distance vision, and the ability to adjust focus. The noise level in the work environment is usually low.

title: Mechanical Structural Design Engineer
description:
Develops, integrates and documents structural and interior payload system requirements to establish the system design. Develops, maintains and modifies structural and interior payload system and component designs, using 3-D Computer Aided Design tools and/or other design methods, to provide product definition to other engineering groups, production operations, suppliers and external customers throughout the product lifecycle. Performs, integrates analytical and test results to validate and verify systems and components meet requirements and specifications. Manages supplier development, test and production activities and coordinates with the supplier to optimize the design and achieve program goals. Develops new design/analysis processes and tools to improve the effectiveness, quality and efficiency of the development effort. Investigates emerging technologies to develop concepts for future product designs to meet projected requirements. Works under general direction.

Level 3 Must Haves:  
-Catia experience  
-Experience with layouts, drawings  
-Experience with structures with airlines, commercial structures  
- MUST have one of the following degrees: BS/MS Mechanical, Aerospace or Civil  
- Level 3: 8 years of experience

Design engineers  
- Boeing Commercial Airplane Structures Fuselage/Wing experience and layout experience  
- Design integration experience working with suppliers and global partners

Job Type: Temporary

Salary: $70.00 - $75.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Remote

title: Environmental Project Engineer
description:
**Position:** Project Engineer  

**Location:** Pleasant Hill, CA  

  

At Apex Companies, we're on a mission to grow and expand in the environmental consulting and engineering industry. We're seeking highly motivated individuals with a strong work ethic to join our dynamic team. If you're eager to grow professionally and want to work with a company that invests in your development, Apex may be the perfect fit for you.  

  

**Why Apex?**  

We're not just any environmental consulting firm – we're a passionate force dedicated to excellence. With record-breaking sales, an impressive client retention rate, strategic acquisitions, and an unwavering commitment to our mission, Apex is among the fastest-growing firms in the US environmental sector. Our dedication to excellence has earned us numerous awards for project success, and we're poised for even greater growth. Join us and grow along with the best in the industry.  

  

**Your Responsibilities as a Project Engineer:**

* Conduct and manage environmental investigations, soil and groundwater remediation, soil gas and indoor air evaluations, etc., for a variety of clients with complex technical and regulatory issues
* Meet with clients and regulatory agencies, including the US Environmental Protection Agency, the Department of Toxic and Substances Control, the Regional Water Quality Control Board and local Environmental Health agencies.
* Write and review remedial documents and reports such as feasibility studies, remedial and/or corrective action plans, remedial design documents, remedial progress and completion reports, etc.
* Design and negotiate remedial solutions for contaminated soil and ground water
* Coordinate the investigation of field work for client projects including scheduling and oversight of utility locating, excavation, and drilling firms
* Meet or exceed client’s scope, budget, and schedule expectations
* Evaluate sample results and develop tables and figures for technical reports
* Write and review proposals
* Mentor, train, and oversee scientific staff and ensure quality work product
* Ensure project work is completed safely while maintaining quality and integrity of work and data
* Actively develop your own career growth

  

**Why you'll love working for us:*** Flexible work-arrangement
* Company-subsidized medical and dental.
* Company-paid life, short, and long-term disability.
* Paid Time Off and Holidays.
* 401k match, tuition assistance, and more.
* Cross-training and the ability to work on a variety of projects.
* Performance-based bonuses or other incentives.
* Working with the best and brightest in the industry.
* 1,000+ employee national firm with 50+ locations across the US.


**What we're looking for:*** BS in environmental engineering, civil engineering, or chemical engineering. Master's degree is preferred.
* Engineer-In-Training (EIT) is preferred and PE is a huge plus; Professional Project Manager (PMP) certification a plus
* 5+ years of experience providing environmental consulting services including technical writing, technical oversight, and project management on various projects including solvent- and petroleum-contaminated sites
* 40-hour OSHA certification and current 8-Hour HAZWOPER refresher
* Ability to effectively interact with clients, regulatory agencies, field staff, technical staff, and subcontractors.
* Ability to write project work plans, health and safety plans, traffic control plans, erosion control plans, etc.
* Ability to mentor, train, and manage staff
* Strong technical writing and communication skills
* Strong safety awareness, good working safety record, and understanding of safe work practices
* Proficiency with Microsoft Office suite

**Interested? Apply today.**  

  

Apex Companies, LLC is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer and a drug-free workplace.  

  

*TO ALL RECRUITMENT AGENCIES: Apex Companies does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes for any of our job postings, to our careers sites, or to any employees of Apex Companies or affiliates. Apex Companies is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.*

title: Structural Engineer
description:
Are you passionate about driving innovation in renewable energy construction? Do you have a proven track record in structural analysis and design? RCAM Technologies is seeking a dynamic and skilled Structural Engineer to join our team.

  


RCAM Technologies is a cleantech startup that uses 3D concrete printing to reduce the cost of renewable energy and create domestic jobs. We develop cutting-edge, award-winning products for floating solar, offshore wind, wave energy, and subsea energy storage. Our research and development is supported by funding agencies including the U.S. Department of Energy, California Energy Commission, New York State Energy Research and Development Authority, National Science Foundation, and other domestic and international grant agencies.


*Success in this position will be measured primarily through:*


* On-time and quality execution of structural design and analysis tasks for R&D projects
* Capability to design and develop new structural systems and products
* Reporting progress and outcomes in technical reports for company and external stakeholders

  


**Who You Are:**


* Skilled structural engineer with experience in advanced structural design
* Looking forward to tackling new challenges in an entrepreneurial environment
* An adaptive problem solver, leader, and strong communicator
* High attention to detail, efficient, organized, reliable, and professional
* Collaborative, inclusive, treats others with respect, and actively values diverse perspectives

  


**What You Will Do:**



The Structural Engineer will contribute to RCAM’s success by carrying out the company’s structural design and functions. This person will help expand RCAM’s structural engineering operations, execute engineering tasks in support of grant funded R&D projects, and strategize on new product designs and development.


*Primary responsibilities:*


* Design RCAM’s 3D printed concrete products including anchors for marine renewable energy and a marine pumped hydro energy storage technology.
* Perform advanced structural analyses.
* Provide strategic input on product design, manufacturing, and testing of prototypes.
* Interface with 3D printing R&D team to incorporate learnings from printing trials into designs.
* Write technical reports and prepare presentations for internal use and for clients.
* Communicate findings at academic/industry conferences and meetings.
* Contribute to ideation and concept design of new renewable energy infrastructure products.

  


**What You Will Get:**



RCAM is growing startup at the intersection between three booming and impactful industries: renewable energy, energy storage, and 3D concrete printing. By joining the team, you will use your expertise in structural engineering in a new creative frontier, solving crucial engineering challenges to accelerate the energy transition and mitigate climate change.


* Annual salary of $90,000 to $130,000
* Flexibility to work remotely with an opportunity to work at RCAM’s office in AltaSea at the Port of Los Angeles or New York Facility
* Mentorship and training under a Professional Engineer
* Ten (10) paid holidays per year
* 4 weeks paid time off plus 6 days paid sick leave per year
* 401(k) retirement savings plan
* Preferred computer and peripherals

  


**Qualifications, Skills, and Experience:**


*Essential:*


* Bachelor of Science in Civil or Structural Engineering and 5+ years of professional experience
* Or Master’s in Civil or Structural Engineering and 3+ years of professional experience
* Or PhD in Structural Engineering with 1+ years of professional experience
* Ability to get Professional Engineer (PE) License within six months of hiring
* Knowledge and experience in the design and analysis of reinforced concrete structures
* Experience in advanced structural analysis software, e.g., Abaqus and SAP2000
* Ability to prioritize tasks, organize work, and execute tasks independently or with other teams.
* Creativity, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills required to apply technical knowledge to a wide variety of non-building structures.
* Excellent interpersonal skills, oral, and written communication
* Ability and willingness to travel up to approximately 5% of the time domestically and internationally


*Preferred:*


* Structural Engineer (SE) License
* Experience in offshore structural analysis and design
* Experience in marine and pre-stressed concrete design and seismic design experience
* Experience and knowledge in geotechnical design of foundations, piles, and anchors.
* Experience in laboratory structural testing of reinforced concrete structures
* Experience in the design, analysis, and testing of 3D concrete printed structures


If you are a dynamic, forward-thinking professional with a passion for structural engineering, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity. Join us at RCAM Technologies and contribute to shaping the future of renewable energy!

  


**How to Apply:**



Interested candidates should submit their resume and a cover letter at RCAM’s hiring page https://rcam-technologies.rippling-ats.com/.

  


*RCAM Technologies is an* *equal opportunity employer and is committed to fostering an environment that is inclusive and welcoming for leadership and team members with different backgrounds, identities, and lived experiences. By welcoming “diversity,” we mean that our organization embraces differences in identity, age, culture, ancestry, ethnicity, race, color, sexual orientation, physical ability, learning style, religion, familial status, marital status, occupation, veteran status, nationality, and the many forms of composite subjectivity and life experiences. Hence, we strongly encourage applications from BIPOC (Black, Indigenous, and People of Color) individuals, people from working-class backgrounds, women, LGBTQIA+ people, and veterans.*

title: Civil Engineer, PE
description:
**Job Summary:**

Navarro & Wright Consulting Engineers, Inc. is an established MBE/DBE firm providing full spectrum civil engineering and related services in the Mid-Atlantic region. We’ve been around since 1996 and we’re ranked as one of the top engineering firms. We use the latest technology and methodologies to exceed our client expectations.

We are looking for a Site - Civil Engineer/Project Manager to join our team in New Cumberland, PA! In this important role, you will be responsible for coordination of technical activities on assigned projects. Projects typically involve a broad range of municipal-related infrastructure projects, including civil, land development, water, wastewater, stormwater, and transportation projects.

**Schedule:**

Full-time – 40 hours a week.

We are proud of our ability to offer flexibility to provide a better work life balance. You will be able to work remotely in a hybrid arrangement and take advantage of our flextime policy.

**Salary Range:**

Competitive compensation commensurate with experience. Broad range for the position is: $90,000 to $105,000.

**Job Responsibilities:**

· Planning, scheduling, conducting and coordinating the technical and production aspects of projects.

· Site grading, stormwater, erosion control, utilities and related project work.

· Regular communication and contact with assigned project clients and sub-consultants.

· Assisting in the marketing of N&W’s services as well as the preparation of engineering project proposals.

· Monitoring of regulations that affect our clients, our industry and N&W.

· Participation in client/contractor meetings and resolution of client/engineering project issues.

· Maintaining project schedule by monitoring project progress, coordinating activities, and resolving problems.

· Preparing project status reports when requested by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing information and trends as well as recommending action.

**Requirements:**

· Bachelor of Science in Civil Engineering or Land Scape Architecture

· Pennsylvania PE

· Minimum 6 years of experience

· Technical proficiency in using the latest versions of AutoCAD, Civil 3D, and MicroStation

· Valid Driver’s license

***When you join Navarro & Wright, you join a team of exceptional professionals working collaboratively to provide services of the highest quality. Our human talent is our most important talent.***

**Employees enjoy these great benefits!**

**Competitive Compensation** – We have an annual pay review process incorporating market data and compensate you for the experience you gain working for the company.

**Annual Profit-Sharing Bonus Potential** – We are all in this together! Our collaborative work environment helps us all share in the growth and success of the company.

**Flexible Schedules** – We understand the importance of balancing your job with your personal life. Many of our positions offer flexible schedules and hybrid/remote working arrangements.

**Time off** – Hard work should be rewarded. You’ll receive a generous amount of paid time off in addition to company paid holidays.

**Healthcare** – We offer multiple options for medical, dental and vision coverage. You choose plans that work for you and the company picks up a generous amount of the cost.

**Life, Short- and Long-Term Disability Insurances** – The company pays for coverage, so you and your family have peace of mind. Supplemental insurance options are also provided.

**Paid Parental Leave** – The company provides up to two weeks of Paid Parental Leave after the birth, adoption or foster placement of a child.

**Retirement Fund** – Save for retirement with a traditional or Roth 401(k). We provide a competitive matching of your contribution.

**Professional Development & Continuing Education** – Your professional development is a high priority. From exam preparation courses to organization membership fees, we have you covered. Educational assistance is also available for college credit courses.

**Great Place to Work** – We think we’ve got something special here, and we think you’ll agree. Trust, autonomy, support and mentorship. You’ll have the ingredients to reach your full potential. Join us!

#Hybrid

#Remote

*Navarro & Wright Consulting Engineers, Inc. fully complies with all applicable federal, state, and local laws, rules, and regulations in the area of non-discrimination in employment. Discrimination against employees or applicants due to race, color, religion, sex (including sexual harassment), national origin, disability, age, military and protected veteran status is strictly prohibited.*

Site Civil Engineering, Civil Engineering, Design Engineering, Project Engineering

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $90,000.00 - $105,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Flexible schedule
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Parental leave
* Professional development assistance
* Referral program
* Tuition reimbursement
* Vision insurance

Compensation package:

* Bonus opportunities

Experience level:

* 6 years

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

* Do you have the right to work in the US?

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

License/Certification:

* Certified Professional Engineer or EIT (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

title: Intelligent Transportation System Engineer (Remote Opportunity)
description:
**Company Description** **Work with Us. Change the World.**


At AECOM, we're delivering a better world. Whether improving your commute, keeping the lights on, providing access to clean water, or transforming skylines, our work helps people and communities thrive. We are the world's trusted infrastructure consulting firm, partnering with clients to solve the world’s most complex challenges and build legacies for future generations.


There has never been a better time to be at AECOM. With accelerating infrastructure investment worldwide, our services are in great demand. We invite you to bring your bold ideas and big dreams and become part of a global team of nearly 50,000 planners, designers, engineers, scientists, digital innovators, program and construction managers and other professionals delivering projects that create a positive and tangible impact around the world.


We're one global team driven by our common purpose to deliver a better world. Join us.

 **Job Description** **AECOM** is seeking a **Intelligent Transportation System Engineer** to be a **Remote Position** based in the **United States**.


We are actively seeking a self-motivated, ITS Engineer with a desire for data analytics, traffic operations, and research of emerging technologies and processes for immediate employment within our Transportation Department. The position provides the opportunity to work on exciting, challenging, and high-profile transportation operations projects.


The ITS Engineer will be responsible for managing, analyzing, and visualizing data for use in transportation and traffic systems and applications, researching state of the practices and innovative practices for various transportation engineering topics, writing technical reports. Join a team of experienced transportation operations experts to develop innovative solutions applying new and emerging technology to transportation.

**Job Functions Include:**

* Work on a wide range of ITS related project, including research, emerging technologies, and ITS deployments.
* Collecting, analyzing, and modeling transportation data from multiple sources, including spatial and non-spatial data for reporting and visualization to develop detailed processes and products that are creative and easy to consume in different applications.
* Develop presentations to internal and external customers.
* Performance measure research, development and maintenance for both roadway performance and operational performance.
* Preparation of weekly, quarterly and annual performance measure reports.
* Conduct literature reviews and develop surveys to determine state of the practice, best practices, and innovative practices for various transportation topics to determine recommendation for clients.
* Assist in data development, integration, integrity, and quality assurance activities
* Development of custom tools (conceptual, front end, and/or backend)
* Additional responsibilities as assigned by AECOM

  

**Qualifications** **Minimum Requirements**

* BA/BS + 2 years of relevant experience or demonstrated equivalency of experience and/or education

**Preferred Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s college degree in Civil Engineering, or other related field with an emphasis in traffic or transportation or demonstrated equivalency of experience and/or education
* Capable of multi-tasking and working in a fast-paced environment
* Ability to prioritize and meet task deadlines
* Adaptable and flexible to various projects
* Thinks creatively and proactively uses technology and software solutions to make operations more efficient
* Technical writing
* Microsoft Software (Excel, Access, SharePoint, Teams, other)
* Geospatial Software (ArcGIS, QGIS, CAD, other)
* Business Intelligence Software (PowerBI, Tableau, other)
* Programming Languages (R, Python, C++, Javascript, SQL, other)

  

**Additional Information** **Here, you will have freedom to grow in a world of opportunity.**


We will give you the flexibility you need to do your best work with hybrid work options. Whether you’re working from an AECOM office, remote location or at a client site, you will be working in a dynamic environment where your integrity, entrepreneurial spirit and pioneering mindset are championed.


You will help us foster a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion – a safe and respectful workplace, where we invite everyone to bring their whole selves to work using their unique talents, backgrounds and expertise to create transformational outcomes for our clients.


We will encourage you to grow and develop your career with us through our technical and professional development programs and diverse career opportunities. We believe in leadership at all levels. No matter where you sit in the organization you can make a lasting impact on the projects you work on, the teams and committees you join and our business.


We offer competitive pay and benefits, well-being programs to support you and your family, and the development resources you need to advance your career.


When you join us, you will connect and collaborate with a global network of experts – planners, designers, engineers, scientists, consultants, program and construction managers – leading the change toward a more sustainable and equitable future. Join us and let’s get started.

**About AECOM**


AECOM is the world’s trusted infrastructure consulting firm, delivering professional services throughout the project lifecycle – from advisory, planning, design and engineering to program and construction management. On projects spanning transportation, buildings, water, new energy and the environment, our public- and private-sector clients trust us to solve their most complex challenges. Our teams are driven by a common purpose to deliver a better world through our unrivaled technical and digital expertise, a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion, and a commitment to environmental, social and governance priorities. AECOM is a Fortune 500 firm and its Professional Services business had revenue of $14.4 billion in fiscal year 2023. See how we are delivering sustainable legacies for generations to come at aecom.com and @AECOM.

 **Freedom to Grow in a World of Opportunity**


You will have the flexibility you need to do your best work with hybrid work options. Whether you’re working from an AECOM office, remote location or at a client site, you will be working in a dynamic environment where your integrity, entrepreneurial spirit and pioneering mindset are championed.


You will help us foster a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion – a safe and respectful workplace, where we invite everyone to bring their whole selves to work using their unique talents, backgrounds and expertise to create transformational outcomes for our clients.


AECOM provides a wide array of compensation and benefits programs to meet the diverse needs of our employees and their families. We also provide a robust global well-being program. We’re the world’s trusted global infrastructure firm, and we’re in this together – your growth and success are ours too.


Join us, and you’ll get all the benefits of being a part of a global, publicly traded firm – access to industry-leading technology and thinking and transformational work with big impact and work flexibility. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each person’s potential, and we’ll help you reach yours.


All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

description:

title: Associate Engineer - Civil
description:
Join Rimkus and unlock your potential with endless opportunities for growth, learning, and making a difference!



Rimkus (www.rimkus.com) is a worldwide leader in Engineering and Technical Consulting. Rimkus experts specialize in building envelope, engineering, forensic consulting, dispute resolution, construction management services, and solutions built for the environment.



NOW IS THE TIME to join this growing and stable company! We offer our full-time employees a competitive salary, bonus opportunities and a full benefits package that includes medical, dental, vision, life, disability, employer-matching 401(k), and opportunities for advancement!


**Overview**



This position is responsible for assisting project managers and engineers with forensic consulting services requiring civil/structural engineering expertise for insurance, legal, industrial, and other clients. Works under the guidance of a senior engineer to gather field information, perform inspections, document job sites, and review weather data and other necessary documents to assess and determine the cause and origin of structural failures and construction defects.


**Essential Job Functions**


* Performs forensic assignments within the field of civil/structural engineering expertise based upon a scope of work and budget prepared by the consultant and agreed upon by the Client in advance of performing the work.
* Investigations: Study and determine the cause and origin of claims related to moisture intrusion, roof damage, and structural damage.
* Ability to initiate, develop, and maintain mutually beneficial client relationships.
* Evaluates and reviews design and field engineering changes during construction.
* Ensures work quality and adherence to specifications.


**Required Education and Certifications**


* B.S. Civil or Structural Engineering degree or higher.
* E.I.T. Certification Required.
* 0-4+ years of experience.
* Proficiency with AutoCAD is desired.


**Required Skills and Abilities**


* Must have a high level of analytical skills. Work requires continual attention to detail with the ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills.
* Must be able to interact and communicate with clients at all levels (e.g. internal and external).
* Proficiency with Microsoft Word and Excel.


**Physical Demands, Overtime, and Travel Requirements**


**Physical Demands** - Work is performed both in an office setting and at outside locations (i.e. Client’s office, industrial, construction, and/or residential sites). Employee is frequently required to stand, walk on slope roofs, sit, climb ladders, bend, climb inside attics and crawl under homes and tunnels, balance, stoop, kneel, crouch, talk, hear, and drive a motor vehicle to job sites. Employee may lift and/or move up to 50 pounds. Employee must be sharp, focused, and alert when conducting site inspections, speaking and interacting with clients, preparing written reports of findings, and testifying in deposition or trial. Clear vision and depth perception are also necessary.


**Overtime** - This position is classified as salaried with an exempt FLSA status. Regular working hours are 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m., Monday through Friday, with one hour for lunch. There will be periods where overtime will be required, which the employee will need to comply with in order to meet the demands of the position.


**Travel Requirements** - This position requires up to 25% local and regional travel. Some out-of-area and overnight travel may be required.



At Rimkus, we value a diverse and inclusive workplace where all employees feel valued and respected. We are committed to creating a work environment that supports and celebrates the unique perspectives and experiences of all employees. If you share our commitment to diversity and inclusivity and are excited about joining a welcoming and supportive team, we encourage you to apply for our open positions.



Rimkus is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employee and will make all employment-related decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.



THIS JOB DESCRIPTION IS SUBJECT TO CHANGE AND DOES NOT CONSTITUTE A CONTRACT FOR EMPLOYMENT OR A GUARANTEE OF CONTINUED EMPLOYMENT.



#LI-PH1



#LI-REMOTE


Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities


The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

title: Senior Civil Engineer
description:
Job Type: Full-Time

Experience Level: 5-10 years

Required Certification: PE (CA or ID preferred)

We are seeking a Senior Civil Designer with 5-10 years experience in private land development in the Boise, Idaho office or remotely in the Southern California area. We have an office in Boise but working remotely from a home office is an option. We are looking to expand our presence in Southern California so our candidate can reside in the So. Cal area, also. We are a small firm, and our Senior Civil Designers will take on all aspects of projects: design, planning, and execution of various civil engineering projects in the commercial, industrial, and residential markets. Candidate will manage multiple projects and will work with other engineering staff to complete the design for each project.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

* Candidates should have a working knowledge of grading, earthwork, demolition, water quality, hydrology/hydraulic reports, storm drain, street, water and sewer design.
* Prepare preliminary and final engineering construction documents for commercial, industrial, and residential projects.
* Ability to manage projects from start to finish and proficiency in AutoCAD Civil 3D required.
* Identify design criteria plus plan and execute effective designs.
* Spearhead plan processing at public agencies.
* Implement innovative design and plan preparation focused on exceeding client expectations.
* Ability to manage a number of engineers as part of a project team.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

* A BS degree in Civil Engineering from a four-year accredited college or university
* Minimum of 3-5 years as an entry-level engineer and 1-3 years as a Project Manager in the Land Development Field
* Excellent oral and written communication skills
* Proficiency with CAD software
* Valid Driver's License with Insurable Record
* Willingness to work over-time as needed
* PE required.

COMPENSATION

* Salary: Negotiable – Annual salary plus bonuses
* Healthcare
* Flexible Schedule
* Flexible Vacation
* 14 Paid Holidays
* Sick Days

To apply for the position of Civil Engineer Designer at C3 Civil Engineering, please submit the following documents via email to karin@c3civileng.com:

* Updated resume, including academic qualifications, work experience, and technical skills.
* A sample set of design plans showing your work.
* Any additional certifications or relevant documents.

Please note that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for further evaluation.

* Paid time off

* Yearly bonus

Experience level:

Work Location: Remote

title: Civil Engineer
description:
**Company Overview**
Nevados is the premier solar tracker company for PV power plants built on sloped and rolling terrain. We offer innovative all-terrain trackers paired with a comprehensive software suite in an integrated technology platform that optimizes solar performance, improves plant reliability and respects the natural landscape. Headquartered in Oakland and backed by institutional capital, Nevados is transforming utility-scale PV deployment with our tracking solutions and partnership approach.  

Nevados is a distributed organization with many team members working remotely, while other roles require an in office and on-site presence. Specifics of the work location, travel expectations and other role requirements are outlined in the position overview. Ideal candidates are self-starters who are able to direct and manage their time wisely.  

  

We are Nevados Engineering, an innovative startup based in San Francisco, CA that is pioneering in the solar industry. At Nevados, we believe that solar installations should fit to the earth instead of forcing the earth to fit to solar installations. We set out to make solar a cost-competitive source of clean energy in every way possible. We specialize in designing and selling mounting systems, typically called Single Axis Trackers, and other related innovative technology to elevate the solar industry. Our core product, the Nevados “All Terrain Tracker”, is unique in that it enables installation on ungraded terrain which triples the amount of land available for developers, reduces construction costs, and reduces construction labor on flat, sloped, and rolling terrain.  

We are currently seeking an experienced Civil Engineer to lead the implementation and development of our topography aware platform to optimize the design, construction, and performance of our solar energy projects. In this role, you will be responsible for civil construction plans, point files, and grading analysis at the preliminary design stage, issuing for construction, and for field remediation solutions during construction. Your tasks will include generating grading reports, point file analysis, foundation mapping, and managing civil RFIs from our customers. Effective communication, collaboration, and providing valuable feedback will be vital in serving our customers and enhancing our product line.  


### **Responsibilities**

* Lead the design, development, and implementation of a topography aware platform that integrates GIS (Geographic Information System) data, geospatial analysis, and other relevant technologies to optimize solar project site selection, design, and construction.
* Serve as the source of truth for civil design for the product and projects.
* Process and review provided topography data in Civil 3D and GIS
* Perform net-slope analysis to accurately determine the correct product to use for each post.
* Perform grading analyses using GIS software and Civil 3D based on provided contour data to provide civil quantity estimates for construction financial modeling.
* Perform water surface analyses using GIS software and Civil 3D based on provided hydrology modeling to review minimum freeboard requirement is met.
* Provide technical expertise during the construction phase, overseeing civil engineering aspects, ensuring quality control, and resolving any on-site issues.
* Perform value engineering exercises to minimize project costs while identifying and proactively addressing potential risks and challenges related to site conditions through effective mitigation strategies.
* Maintain accurate records, reports, and documentation related to project design, development, and construction.
* Collaborate with engineers to update product configurations, drafting standards, and potentially develop automation procedures.
* Assess site information and design inputs to select suitable product types based on site conditions.
* Conduct thorough analysis to determine optimal foundation locations for solar panel arrays, considering factors such as soil stability, load-bearing capacity, and geological conditions.
* Work with customers to design the tracker to meet flood and scour requirements.
* Contribute to product development, ensuring a thorough understanding of the product.
* Support construction by managing Requests for Information (RFIs) and submittals.
* Supervise and coordinate with third-party vendors.
* Ensure effective communication and collaboration with internal teams, contractors, and stakeholders throughout the project lifecycle.

### **Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s degree in civil engineering or related field.
* Proven experience (3+ years) as a Civil Engineer, preferably in utility-scale solar tracker projects or similar renewable energy systems.
* Strong knowledge of structural engineering principles, with a focus on solar tracker design.
* Proficiency in AutoCAD, Civil 3D, GIS software, and SolidWorks.
* Familiarity with Bluebeam Revu and MATLAB
* Familiarity with topography analysis, hydrology analysis, and value engineering.
* Excellent project management skills, including task prioritization, resource management, and risk mitigation.
* In-depth knowledge of solar development, site design principles, grading, erosion control, and stormwater management.
* Strong problem-solving and analytical abilities with attention to detail.
* Effective communication and collaboration skills to work with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.


Actual base salary may vary depending on job-related factors, which may include knowledge, skills, experience, and location. **Benefits & Total Compensation Package**
Nevados offers competitive base salary, bonus, and equity commensurate with qualifications and experience. Full time employees are provided medical, dental, vision, 401(k), life insurance, and unlimited PTO, with additional benefit offerings as we continue to grow.  

  

This job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change or new ones may be assigned at any time with or without notice.  

  

Unless otherwise explicitly stated as a requirement of the role, candidates must be willing to travel at least 10-20% of the time for company off-sites, conferences, trade shows, site visits, and other potential events as needed.  

  

*Don't meet every qualification listed in the job posting above? Apply anyways! Nevados is an Equal Opportunity Employer and committed to building a more inclusive ecosystem that integrates women, people of color, and other underrepresented groups into the cleantech sector and the overall tech industry. We strongly encourage applications from qualified individuals and members of underrepresented groups, even if your past experience doesn't align perfectly. You might be a fit for this role or another open position.*

title: Civil Drainage Engineer - Transportation Infrastructure
description:
In a world of possibilities, pursue one with endless opportunities. Imagine Next!
When it comes to what you want in your career, if you can imagine it, you can do it at Parsons. Imagine a career working with intelligent, diverse people sharing a common quest. Imagine a workplace where you can be yourself. Where you can thrive. Where you can find your next, right now. We’ve got what you’re looking for.
**Job Description:**

**Civil Drainage Engineer – USA / Remote**

**Opportunity :**

Would you enjoy being involved on a wide variety of civil engineering tasks on small to large scale, transportation projects? **Parsons** is now hiring a **Civil** **Drainage Engineer** for design-build and design-bid-build projects located around the USA to support various state and Federal **road and highway projects ..** 

**This role can be based anywhere in the USA, and allows for a remote based work situation , or the ability to work from a local Parsons office on a hybrid basis , if desired.**

Parsons extensive experience in this field, combined with your engineering knowledge, will propel your career forward with opportunity for advancement with top performance. We need our engineers to be versatile, enthusiastic to work in highly flexible, team-oriented environment and who have exceptional communication, analytical and management skills.


In this role: you will be engaged in engineering drainage and irrigation designs, hydraulic systems modeling, and drainage calculations. You will review construction details, as well as erosion control drawings. Perform quantity calculations and produce/check engineering analytical data and related information to assure the design and any technical reports are accurate. Deliver critical design components regarding project scope, and experience supporting any state DOT projects is essential.  



**Responsibilities :**

* Independently develops and/or supervises the creation of engineering products that meet customer quality requirements. This includes defining the problem, establishing the work scope, preparing the budget and schedule, planning the work, providing technical direction, and reporting the work status.
* **Will perform drainage and culvert systems design for various State DOT road and highway projects around the USA.**
* Typical products may include detailed calculations, drawings, procurement documents, design and installation packages, proposal evaluations, technical reports, and detailed analyses.
* Provides support for other engineering activities as required. May supervise one or more subordinates and provide input regarding performance.
* May be assigned to a project or organizational team, or as a lead engineer for a specific discipline on a small to intermediate-size project.
* Provides input and technical guidance to CAD Designer/Drafters, Designers, and lower-level Engineers working on the same project.

***Qualifications*** *:*

* *4-year degree in Civil Engineering (or a related field) is required.*
* ***3 years or more of related work experience with road & highway drainage design , preferably with state DOT projects***
* *Proficiency in utilizing CAD and other PC software packages typically associated with engineering is required. Experience with Microstation and/or Autocad Civil 3D is essential*
* ***Experience supporting any state DOT projects is preferred, but experience with drainage systems design for land development projects is considered*** *. Experience obtaining canal and storm water permits is a plus*
* *Combination of Experience with hydraulic modeling programs of HEC-RAS, HEC-HMS, HY-8, Bentley InRoads Storm & Sanitary, Bentley StormCAD, Aquaveo Watershed Modeling System (WMS), NRCS WinTR-55, Bentley FlowMaster, FHWA Hydraulic Toolbox, and EPA Storm Water Management Model (SWMM) is essential.*

**Minimum Clearance Required to Start:**

Not Applicable/None
This position is part of our Critical Infrastructure team.
For more than 75 years, our experts have designed and delivered the critical infrastructure that connects and protects communities around the world. We work in diverse, collaborative teams, both within the company and with our partners and customers, to plan, design, build, and modernize infrastructure. We take special pride in projects and solutions that improve communities as well as people’s quality of life by promoting economic growth, enhancing mobility, and increasing sustainability and resiliency. Powered by our people, we provide the imagination necessary to support our customers’ visions—and to help them see new possibilities.
Salary Range:


$59,300.00 - $119,700.00
We value our employees and want our employees to take care of their overall wellbeing, which is why we offer best-in-class benefits such as medical, dental, vision, paid time off, Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP), 401(k), life insurance, flexible work schedules, and holidays to fit your busy lifestyle!
The position may require a COVID vaccination or an approved accommodation/exemption for a disability/medical condition or religious belief as required by customer requirements and some cases federal, state, provincial or local mandates.


This position will be posted for a minimum of 3 days and will continue to be posted for an average of 30 days until a qualified applicant is selected or the position has been cancelled.
Parsons is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity, equity, inclusion, and accessibility in the workplace. Diversity is ingrained in who we are, how we do business, and is one of our company’s core values. Parsons equally employs representation at all job levels for minority, female, disabled, protected veteran and LGBTQ+.
We truly invest and care about our employee’s wellbeing and provide endless growth opportunities as the sky is the limit, so aim for the stars! Imagine next and join the Parsons quest—APPLY TODAY!

title: Network Construction Engineer Entry Level Opportunity
description:
### **When you join Verizon**


Verizon is one of the world’s leading providers of technology and communications services, transforming the way we connect around the world. We’re a human network that reaches across the globe and works behind the scenes. We anticipate, lead, and believe that listening is where learning begins. In crisis and in celebration, we come together—lifting up our communities and striving to make an impact to move the world forward. If you’re fueled by purpose, and powered by persistence, explore a career with us. Here, you’ll discover the rigor it takes to make a difference and the fulfillment that comes with living the #NetworkLife.

### **What you’ll be doing...**


From internships and co-ops to leadership development programs and entry-level roles, Verizon’s award-winning Campus program allows you to take the next step toward shaping your future. Our Campus program has been recognized with awards like WayUp’s Top 100 Internship Programs and RippleMatch’s Campus Forward Award. Why the accolades? It’s easy. We quickly immerse our early in career V Teamers in meaningful work that delivers tangible business impact. Plus, you’ll have the opportunity to network with V Teamers across the globe, find mentors, and establish meaningful friendships that could last a lifetime. Start here and go anywhere, with opportunities across the business. When students like you join the V Team, our network becomes even stronger.


This position is for an entry level Network Construction Engineer role in the Verizon Global Network & Technology organization. In this role you will be introduced to the planning & implementation of PSC (power, space & cooling infrastructure) in Verizon's wireless MSC facilities. You will shadow and support various PSC personnel in their day-to-day activities and may be asked to work on special projects.


As a Network Construction Engineer you will:

* Attending weekly Construction status calls and support PSC Engineers.
* Attending vendor site surveys.
* Assisting in review of equipment pre-vet requests & vendor proposals.
* Collecting data and develop special reports related to project management tracking and/or capacity/budget analysis.


You must be currently enrolled in a degree program and be in good academic standing to be considered.


In this hybrid full time position, you’ll have a defined work location that includes work from home and assigned office days set by your manager. This hybrid role will be based out of Alpharetta, Georgia.


If you are interested in other roles and locations in addition to this one, please submit your application to those postings as well in order to be considered.


### **What we’re looking for...**


You’re a motivated self-starter. Never satisfied with the status quo, you’re always trying to perform at your personal best. You thrive in a fast-paced environment where new challenges come up every day. You are flexible, dependable, and work well in varying environments. Learning quickly is personally rewarding and inspires you to take smart risks.

### **You’ll need to have:**

* Current enrollment in a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree majoring in Telecommunications, Information Technology, Data Analytics, Data Science, Computer Science, Construction Management, Civil Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or related majors with a completion date of June 2024.
* Authorization to work in the U.S. without restrictions or need for future sponsorship.
* Willingness to travel and work in Alpharetta, Georgia.

### **Even better if you have one or more of the following:**

* Coursework or knowledge of electrical/mechanical systems.
* Coursework or demonstrated experience with AutoCAD.
* Demonstrated strong written and communication skills.
* Experience working with Microsoft Office and/or Google Suite
* Basic knowledge of Data Analysis.


If Verizon and this role sound like a fit for you, we encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet every “even better” qualification listed above.

### **Where you’ll be working**


In this hybrid role, you'll have a defined work location that includes work from home and assigned office days set by your manager.### **Scheduled Weekly Hours**


40### **Equal Employment Opportunity**


We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer - and celebrate our employees’ differences, including race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, and Veteran status. At Verizon, we know that diversity makes us stronger. We are committed to a collaborative, inclusive environment that encourages authenticity and fosters a sense of belonging. We strive for everyone to feel valued, connected, and empowered to reach their potential and contribute their best. Check out our diversity and inclusion page to learn more.
